commit_message:
Fix wrong disk size for sparse flat files

The libvirt driver creates flat disks as sparse by default. However,
it always returns over_committed_disk_size=0 for flat disks
in _get_instance_disk_info(). This incorrect data ends up being reported
to the scheduler in the libvirt driver's get_available_resource() via
_get_disk_over_committed_size_total(). get_instance_disk_info() should use
allocated blocks, not file size, when calculating over_commited_disk_size for
flat disks. We can just use qemu-img tool to file disk size same as qcow2.

Closes-Bug: #1593155

Change-Id: I593a913779746730587df313a24e64680891e515

commit_message:
Adds new molecule testing for tripleo-container-manage

This test ensure the "create" part is working fine with an easy and
simple container. The container-create and default scenario have been
consoldated so its running one complete test for now.

Change-Id: I9139c7b63c15739a1a95d913acb1128af299ce97
Co-Authored-By: Emilien Macchi <emilien@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kecarter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
conf: Remove libvirt imagecache

Config options related to imagecache should be removed. However, it is
not currently entirely possible due to the upgrade issue - if someone is
doing a leap frog upgrades and would not run Ocata for a longer period
of time there is high probability that imagecache files will still be
around after the upgrade.

Removes ``checksum_base_images`` and ``checksum_interval_seconds``, and
set the default value of ``remove_unused_resized_minumum_age_seconds``
to 0 (from 3600) to address the problem described above. This option is
also deprecated to allow for its removal after Pike.

Change-Id: I7b422f3bb4d61f91574be4df612fa7db5f83533a
Implements: blueprint centralize-config-options-pike
Co-Authored-By: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2019-04-08 13:45:23.000000000', 'message': 'Fix amp failover where failover already failed

If a failover ran on an amphora and was unsuccessful and reverted, it
would mark the amp status "DELETED" and un-busy the health record.
It would then be picked up on the next failover check, start failing
over, and break early since it appeared to be "unallocated".

Also, housekeeping can now clean up expired amphora records based on the
amphora's updated_at time instead of the health record's time, which
means the records won't be immediately cleaned up anymore after they go
through failover flows.

commit_message:
Fix amp failover where failover already failed

If a failover ran on an amphora and was unsuccessful and reverted, it
would mark the amp status "DELETED" and un-busy the health record.
It would then be picked up on the next failover check, start failing
over, and break early since it appeared to be "unallocated".

Also, housekeeping can now clean up expired amphora records based on the
amphora's updated_at time instead of the health record's time, which
means the records won't be immediately cleaned up anymore after they go
through failover flows.

Conflicts:
    octavia/controller/worker/controller_worker.py
    octavia/controller/worker/flows/amphora_flows.py
    octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/flows/test_amphora_flows.py
    octavia/tests/unit/controller/worker/test_controller_worker.py
    tools/create_flow_docs.py

Change-Id: I848b7fc69b977fcb39f8a07e2ea5fc7bd37b5c7a
(cherry picked from commit 96cce3ed74c63e5756e216a8e48c60de09b027c2)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-24 14:03:51.000000000', 'message': 'Restart nova scheduler to refresh cell cache

Reloading nova-scheduler is necessary after new cells have been created
to refresh the cell cache.  Ideally we would send a SIGHUP, but due
to a Docker bug (https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/11065) this will
cause the container to be stopped if we restart Docker or reboot the
server.

This change switches to restarting the nova-scheduler container.

Change-Id: Ief73bbd24568d6941384ea3330ab45f11aa42d37
Closes-Bug: #1845244
'}, {'created': '2019-10-25 08:01:13.000000000', 'message': "Fix nova scheduler down after first docker restart

Due to a Docker bug [1] we cannot use Docker to send
SIGHUP to the container because it will mark it as
stopped.
This patch sends the signal directly to the process,
bypassing Docker.

'changed_when: false' is also removed from the

commit_message:
Fix nova scheduler down after first docker restart

Due to a Docker bug [1] we cannot use Docker to send
SIGHUP to the container because it will mark it as
stopped.
This patch sends the signal directly to the process,
bypassing Docker.

'changed_when: false' is also removed from the
relevant task as it definitely changes the state.
In the future we could do the refresh only if
there really is a need for another one.

[1] https://github.com/moby/moby/issues/11065

Change-Id: Ief73bbd24568d6941384ea3330ab45f11aa42d37
Co-authored-by: Radosaw Piliszek <radoslaw.piliszek@gmail.com>
Closes-Bug: #1845244

commit_message:
prevent removing numa_topology usage info from DB

Basically this is reverting patch of below.

commit b6edbce9b3b092581eeda6be15059a1ba2bfcfdf
Author: He Jie Xu <hejie.xu@intel.com>
Date:   Thu Sep 8 19:46:24 2016 +0800

    Ensure ResourceProvider/Inventory created before add
    Allocations record

Because resources in the _copy_resources() only contains basic
information about host numa_toplogy without usage, updating DB at
here is to overwrite previous NUMA usage information in the DB.
The usage will never be recovered thereafter since
_resource_change() in the _update() regards as there are no changes
indeed.

Closes-Bug: #1729621
Closes-Bug: #1739349
Related-Bug: #1621437
Change-Id: I6a488cb9c2744cd34209f718462f00160849d968
Signed-off-by: Minho Ban <mhban@samsung.com>

[{'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:35:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:37:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

(3 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:38:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:45:01.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

(2 comments)

Is see you've done a new version and matt beat me to the comments, will look at next version."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-07-13 16:54:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

I think you should split this into two different changes. One for the bug with the session beign out of date and needing to refresh it, the other for the multiple updates.

I looked into the multiple update situationa while back and also felt like we were doing too many of them, but couldn't be sure that they weren't being done for extra safety. It's not clear that our test coverage is sufficient for the change to be safe, bt I think it is worth trying, espeicially if we can add some tests that make it clear.

On the sessions being out of date, I think it would be better if the code could be more explicit. What you have now is that any situation that results in no resource provider being created causes the session to be rebuilt. Would it be possible to more generally inspect the session to determine if the placement endpoint is not there yet and then fix that?

I agree that we need to be defensive in the face of compute nodes coming up before the the service catalog is complete, but I think we can do it more elegantly than we've got here. It seems like we ought to be able to make use of  ks_exc.EndpointNotFound as seen in safe_connect. Is that coming in to play?"}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 17:01:13.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-07-13 17:03:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

copying my -1 from ps2:

I think you should split this into two different changes. One for the bug with the session beign out of date and needing to refresh it, the other for the multiple updates.

I looked into the multiple update situationa while back and also felt like we were doing too many of them, but couldn't be sure that they weren't being done for extra safety. It's not clear that our test coverage is sufficient for the change to be safe, bt I think it is worth trying, espeicially if we can add some tests that make it clear.

On the sessions being out of date, I think it would be better if the code could be more explicit. What you have now is that any situation that results in no resource provider being created causes the session to be rebuilt. Would it be possible to more generally inspect the session to determine if the placement endpoint is not there yet and then fix that?

I agree that we need to be defensive in the face of compute nodes coming up before the the service catalog is complete, but I think we can do it more elegantly than we've got here. It seems like we ought to be able to make use of  ks_exc.EndpointNotFound as seen in safe_connect. Is that coming in to play?"}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 17:06:03.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 18:23:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

I think no matter what reason cause create rp failed, may be the most simple and effective way is reload the session and retry? only if the ks_session can fix it itself.

the exact reason for create rp failed is loged, and if create successed, _update() will not retry next period while resource usage not changed.

And also the probability of  reload session is very small, and the cost is also small too.'}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 18:28:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 26231, 'date': '2017-07-13 18:45:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6: Patch Set 5 was rebased.'}, {'account_id': 20040, 'date': '2017-07-13 20:42:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Failures to connect with the placement service are handled in the @safe_connect decorator, which retries the connection attempt.

Can we see some evidence please that this is an issue? Can you please post a log that shows the resource tracker failing in some way?

-jay'}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-08-11 11:09:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

The original bug report suggested that the problem shows up when nova-compute starts up before placement is registered in the service catalog but connecting to the service catalog works just fine.

I recall some discussion that if you get a service catalog but the service is not there, safe_connect doesn't actually cause going to get a new session. Instead it carries on using the one it already has.

But yeah, this definitely needs better explanation of what's going on. If we don't get anything from the originator soon I'll look into it next week when I have a spare moment."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-08-14 11:46:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8: Code-Review-1

Yeah, I've experimented with this and it is the case that the service catalog is cached in the client for some amount of time. If you start n-cpu without placement in the catalog, it will fail to find the endpoint, but carry on using the same session, thus using the same catalog.

The _client needs to be re-created.

The fix in here is not right, however, so I'll provide another one, referencing this one."}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2017-08-14 13:05:42.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 8:

I've got a version of this at: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/493536/"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2017-10-05 19:54:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 8: Verified-1

Merge Failed.

'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-30 16:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

This was fixed at https://review.opendev.org/#/c/493536/'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2017-07-13 16:35:59.000000000', 'message': 'fix resource-provider regist failed in db while placement endpoint created after nova-compute start

1.if rp create failed because of endpoint, report-client reload
  keystone session and raise exception. rt catch the exception
  and init the old_resource, cause _update() call report-client
  again next period.

2.delete two duplicate _update() in _init_compute_node(), because
  _update() while called at end of _update_available_resource.
  Too many period db actiions in large scale clusters increase the
  load of database.

Change-Id: Id54d06b13c9f655d78c7ea19313958060076a9a2

'}, {'created': '2017-07-13 17:06:03.000000000', 'message': 'fix rp registration failed while placement endpoint created after compute start

1.if rp create failed because of endpoint, report-client reload
  keystone session and raise exception. rt catch the exception
  and init the old_resource, cause _update() call report-client
  again next period.

2.delete two duplicate _update() in _init_compute_node(), because
  _update() while called at end of _update_available_resource.
  Too many period db actions in large scale clusters increase the
  load of database.

commit_message:
[placement] fix rp create failed when late placement endpoint

If rp create failed because the placement endpoint is not yet available,
the report-client reload keystone session and raise exception. rt catch
the exception and init the old_resource, cause _update() call
report-client again next period.

Related-Bug: #1697825

Change-Id: Id54d06b13c9f655d78c7ea19313958060076a9a2

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 15334, 'date': '2017-11-22 15:33:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-08-02 20:37:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Hi Stephen...I think we actually need to track two things:
1) Is it UEFI?
2) If so, do we want to preserve the NVRAM?

From the libvirt API:  "If the domain has any nvram specified, the undefine process will fail unless VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_KEEP_NVRAM is specified, or if VIR_DOMAIN_UNDEFINE_NVRAM is specified to remove the nvram file."'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-08-06 17:15:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Search for "UEFI variable store file" in the starlingx diff:

https://github.com/starlingx-staging/stx-nova/commit/71acfeae0d1c59fdc77704527d763bd85a276f9a

And you'll see a few things they did which I think address this bug.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-08-15 19:49:23.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Yes, that should cover it.

One of the things StarlingX did was to override where the NVRAM file got stored.  I think that part isn't really needed as long as nova can rely on libvirt to put it at a known location."}, {'account_id': 24562, 'date': '2018-08-16 02:17:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

The nvram file stores the boot information of the UEFI instance, if instance use shared storage like RBD, the next boot may run on other hosts, even if old nvram exists on the source host, it is useless now. so we must keep the specific boot information for a specific instance.
Maybe we can use a text data to store the boot information we need, and then create a new nvram file before next boot. This requires familiarity with the details of uefi and nvram.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-08-16 17:38:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

As far as I know, if you do a nova stop/start the instance will still run on the same host even when using RBD.'}, {'account_id': 8768, 'date': '2018-08-16 17:40:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

We need to tell libvirt to explicitly preserve or delete the NVRAM file when destroying the domain, and we need to explicitly copy the NVRAM file when doing migration/resize.

On an "evacuate" we'll lose the NVRAM data of course.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-30 16:29:29.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

This is old, in merge conflict and has had a -1 for a long time so I'm going to abandon this. There is a newer attempt at fixing this here from the windriver/starlingx team:

https://review.opendev.org/#/c/621646/"}]

[{'created': '2017-06-07 10:14:42.000000000', 'message': 'A way to keep the UEFI nvram contents on libvirt+qemu/kvm

Nova support boot UEFI instance on libvirt+qemu/kvm, but stop and
start the UEFI instance will lead to redefine the instance domain,
every time undefine will delete the uefi nvram, it stores the boot
information of the UEFI instance as MBR boot sector, define a
domain will create a new file from template, so instance will be
lost the boot information at next boot.

This commit is intended to solve this problem, this nvram needs to
be a local file, so we can backup the nvram file before undefined
and restore it before next boot.

Change-Id: If481a093c9816656cbfd936336b41d92ea5f28ba
Closes-Bug: #1633447

commit_message:
A way to keep the UEFI nvram contents on libvirt+qemu/kvm

Nova support boot UEFI instance on libvirt+qemu/kvm, but stop and
start the UEFI instance will lead to redefine the instance domain,
every time undefine will delete the uefi nvram, it stores the boot
information of the UEFI instance as MBR boot sector, define a
domain will create a new file from template, so instance will be
lost the boot information at next boot.

This commit is intended to solve this problem, this nvram needs to
be a local file, so we can backup the nvram file before undefined
and restore it before next boot.

Change-Id: If481a093c9816656cbfd936336b41d92ea5f28ba
Closes-Bug: #1633447

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-06-27 20:36:27.000000000', 'message': "Add granularity to os-services API

The Nova Compute services (os-services) API is not granular enough in
the sense that multiple APIs check the same policy action for list,
update, and delete. This does not allow operators with strict
security requirements to have different roles that can perform
certain os-services APIs but not others - it currently is all or
nothing. As it currently stands, listing, updating, and deleting
compute services checks the single policy action
'os_compute_api:os-services' - which prevents operators who want read
only roles or other sub-admin type roles. To further achieve RBAC
granularity, this patch adds new policy actions to the os-services
API.

To address backwards compatibility, this patch leverages the
'verify_deprecated_policy' method [1] which allows the existing
policy action 'os_compute_api:os-services' or the new actions to be
used.

[1] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/master/nova/policy.py#L230

Closes-Bug: #1778994

Change-Id: Ie8579300792d3ceab1e5c37eade47e599207666f

"}, {'created': '2018-07-06 22:40:40.000000000', 'message': "Add granularity to os-services API

The Nova Compute services (os-services) API is not granular enough in
the sense that multiple APIs check the same policy action for list,
update, and delete. This does not allow operators with strict
security requirements to have different roles that can perform
certain os-services APIs but not others - it currently is all or

'os_compute_api:os-services' - which prevents operators who want read
only roles or other sub-admin type roles. To further achieve RBAC
granularity, this patch adds new policy actions to the os-services
API.

To address backwards compatibility, the following deprecation strategy is
implemented:

  - Introduce the new rules with new default roles
  - Keep enforcing the old rules with same default for deprecation period
  - Give warning for user about switching to old rules to new rules
  - Note we will enforce the old rules as it is till deprecation period and
    new rule as soft enforcement only as it should not effect any user for
    deprecation period
  - After deprecation period. we will remove the old rules and keep enforcing
      the new rules only
~
Closes-Bug: #1778994

Change-Id: Ie8579300792d3ceab1e5c37eade47e599207666f

commit_message:
Add granularity to os-services API

The Nova Compute services (os-services) API is not granular enough in
the sense that multiple APIs check the same policy action for list,
update, and delete. This does not allow operators with strict
security requirements to have different roles that can perform
certain os-services APIs but not others - it currently is all or
nothing. As it currently stands, listing, updating, and deleting
compute services checks the single policy action
'os_compute_api:os-services' - which prevents operators who want read
only roles or other sub-admin type roles. To further achieve RBAC
granularity, this patch adds new policy actions to the os-services
API.

To address backwards compatibility, the following deprecation strategy is
implemented:

  - Introduce the new rules with new default roles
  - Keep enforcing the old rules with same default for deprecation period
  - Give warning for user about switching to old rules to new rules
  - Note we will enforce the old rules as it is till deprecation period and
    new rule as soft enforcement only as it should not affect any user for
    deprecation period
  - After deprecation period, we will remove the old rules and keep enforcing
    the new rules only

Closes-Bug: #1778994
Partially Implements: bp granular-api-policy
Change-Id: Ie8579300792d3ceab1e5c37eade47e599207666f

'}, {'created': '2019-10-28 21:07:14.000000000', 'message': "Fix update share network tests and skip exception issue

After fixing a bug that was allowing share network update when it
shouldn't, the test that validates the share network creation and
update started failing. An additional validation was introduced in
the fix for this bug, and this was this test failure cause. This
patch fixes the test and make it work properly.
This patch fixes test classes that are raising a skip exception
inside the setUpClass function and failing due to testtool issue #272.

Closes-Bug: #1849728
Closes-Bug: #1849377

commit_message:
Fix update share network tests and skip exception issue

After fixing a bug that was allowing share network update when it
shouldn't, the test that validates the share network creation and
update started failing. An additional validation was introduced and
it caused the new bug. This patch fixes the test and make it work
properly.
In addition this patch fixes test classes that are raising a skip
exception inside the setUpClass function and failing due to testtool
issue #272.

Closes-Bug: #1849728
Closes-Bug: #1849377
Related-Bug: #1846836
Co-Author: Carlos Eduardo <ces.eduardo98@gmail.com>
Change-Id: I5b27ee4a9e844ea48dc9324bcf38f5767223717f

How should we filter out those instances with a ``None`` AZ? should we do AZ=None or just AZ? maybe it could not work with the CLI? because we might have to specify something with --availability-zone?'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2018-11-28 08:46:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Later.... Checked, there are no CLIs that can filter instance with AZ, so it is OK, but still, could you explain how to correctly filter those VMs with API?'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2018-11-28 14:32:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 26490, 'date': '2018-11-29 09:46:12.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Yes, I think the fundamental problem is that the availability_zone field in the instance database will not be updated. This problem should be solved, otherwise there will always be problems.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-30 16:07:31.000000000', 'content': "Abandoned

> Yes, I think the fundamental problem is that the availability_zone field in the instance database will not be updated. This problem should be solved, otherwise there will always be problems.

As I said, prior to cells v2 and cell0, what would happen with an instance that fails to schedule? I'm assuming the same thing happened since the requested AZ was probably set on the instance in the API prior to scheduling failing and setting the instance to ERROR state.

If this is no different than before cell0 was introduced, then this is a change in behavior.

This is an opinion either way I think, and is likely abandoned so I'm going to drop this."}]

commit_message:
For instances end up in cell0, set its availability_zone to None.

Instances that have not yet been created will be created in cell0,
after the availability zone is changed, but the available_zone in
the instances database of the instance does not change, which will
cause fail to filter the list of instances by the available zone.

Change-Id: I417318b98b7db77b22c768c7114f33c890616174

commit_message:
Assess ceph request status until it is complete.

Due to a change in the ceph-client interface *1 the
storage-ceph.pools.available flag can be lost when the charm is
upgraded from an old version to the current version. To account for
this check the request status whenever there is an outstanding
ceph request.

*1 https://github.com/openstack/charm-interface-ceph-client/blame/master/requires.py#L107

Change-Id: I179df45af2fb2d4723cd579a1070ece0d18b5002
Closes-Bug: #1850618

commit_message:
Rollback instance vm_state to original where instance claims failed

When rebuild_claim or resize_claim failed because of
ComputeResourceUnavailable exception, we set the vm_state
to original vm_state.

Change-Id: I32f574d4742d0bd1e0d60196cc0756ec6ece7988
Closes-Bug: #1784983

[{'created': '2018-08-30 08:24:42.000000000', 'message': "Fix instance delete stuck in deleting task_state

During instance deletion if rabbitmq-server crashes
after setting instance task_state to 'DELETING' or
'SOFT_DELETING'. That instance will get deleted only
on nova-compute restart.

Extend periodic method _run_pending_deletes to delete
instances stuck in 'DELETING' or 'SOFT_DELETING' task_state.

Record the timestamp of last valid delete request in
instance's system_metadata field. This timestamp is used to
judge whether the deletion is time out and the instance
need to be deleted in _run_pending_deletes.

Rreferences:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281782
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294491

Change-Id: I43e995c3f5d71e56f0b0e136e45a307e329d7ae4
Closes-Bug: #1543511

During instance deletion if rabbitmq-server crashes
after setting instance task_state to ``DELETING`` or
``SOFT_DELETING``. That instance will get deleted only
on nova-compute restart.

1)Add periodic task _cleanup_instances_stuck_in_deleting_task
to delete instances stuck in ``DELETING`` or ``SOFT_DELETING``
task_state. The periodic interval is
``running_deleted_instance_poll_interval`` conf option.

2)Record the timestamp of last valid delete request in
instance's system_metadata field. This timestamp is used to
calculate whether the deletion is time out and the time-out
period is 2 times of running_deleted_instance_poll_interval.

3)Soft delete instance when nova-compute restart if the
instance's task_state is ``SOFT_DELETING``.

Rreferences:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281782

commit_message:
Fix instance delete stuck in deleting task_state

During instance deletion if rabbitmq-server crashes
after setting instance task_state to ``DELETING`` or
``SOFT_DELETING``. That instance will get deleted only
on nova-compute restart.

1) Add periodic task _cleanup_instances_stuck_in_deleting_task
to delete instances stuck in ``DELETING`` or ``SOFT_DELETING``
task_state. The periodic interval is
``running_deleted_instance_poll_interval`` conf option.

2) Soft delete instance when nova-compute restart if the
instance's task_state is ``SOFT_DELETING``.

Rreferences:
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/281782
* https://review.openstack.org/#/c/294491

Change-Id: I43e995c3f5d71e56f0b0e136e45a307e329d7ae4
Closes-Bug: #1543511

'}, {'created': '2018-09-27 01:52:38.000000000', 'message': 'Unable to delete volume when a vmware instance bfv is failed.

when creating a vmware instance from a volume is failed,
vm goes to error state, the volume is in "in use" state, 
and after deleting the vm, the state of the volume is still in 
"in use" and can't be deleted.

The reason of this bug is : When VM failed to boot, an operation of 
detach volume will be execute, but there is no VM in vmware ESXI, so ,
it will raise an exception: InstanceNotFound, so the belowing flow will 
not be execute.Finally, the volume is in "in use" status.
Though this change , we catch the InstanceNotFound exception, and ignore
it, let the flow go on, so that the status of volume can be set to 
"avalible"

Closes-Bug:#1774137
Change-Id: I987d9b46c82b66ecc0ef2453bdd7fce6d3a7810d

commit_message:
Catch the not found exception when powering off a vmware instance

Bug description:
when creating a vmware instance from a volume is failed,
vm goes to error state, the volume is in "in use" state,
and after deleting the vm, the state of the volume is still in
"in use" and can't be deleted.
The reason of this bug is : When VM failed to boot, an operation of
detach volume will be execute, but there is no VM in vmware ESXI, so ,
when powering off this instance in _detach_instance_volumes(),
it will raise an exception: InstanceNotFound.
Finally, the volume is in "in use" status.
Though this change , we catch the InstanceNotFound exception,
and let the flow in destroy() go on,
so that the status of volume can be set to "avalible"

Closes-Bug:#1774137

Change-Id: I987d9b46c82b66ecc0ef2453bdd7fce6d3a7810d

This patch bumps compute service version to 37 to indicate
that attach/detach root volume is supported. It will be checked
in compute/api.py when handling root volume when attaching/detaching.

This patch also makes changes to the start and unshelve API, so that
BFV instances without valid root volume will not be able to
start/unshelve.

Implements: blueprint detach-boot-volume

commit_message:
Add compute service support for attach/detach root volume

This patch bumps compute service version to 38 to indicate
that attach/detach root volume is supported. It will be checked
in compute/api.py when handling root volume when attaching/detaching.

This patch also added a new method reset_fields_for_detached_root_bdm()
to BlockDeviceMapping obj, it will be used in attach/detach root
volume workflow since in these cases, we want to keep the BDM record
but reset some fields.

Implements: blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I073da489005d8f746efcbefd413d20b978be44fa

subject: Detach/Attach root volume API changes

(1 comment)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-01 16:17:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23: Code-Review-1

(9 comments)

I haven't gone through all of this, but a lot more comments/concerns in the API code. The thing that strikes me today is the number of different validations/changes to the instance object itself when the image changes during rebuild, and we're not doing any of that stuff in the root volume attach flow when the root volume image changes...and we probably need those same checks/changes as rebuild, right? Otherwise we'll just have bugs later because someone will say they attached a new root volume with a new image with new metadata and the changes are not reflected in the instance/guest."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-01 19:55:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 23:

FYI that I've rebased and updated the associated tempest test:

https://review.openstack.org/332050"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-03-04 11:32:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 23:

(1 comment)

I will copy the rest of comments to new patchset latter.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-03-04 12:13:34.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 24.'}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-03-04 12:16:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

@Matt, I was only able to do so much today, I added some logic in compute/api.py to handle tags and multiattach. Please check if it works. I will update the tests later. And another thing popped to my head. Is the multi-attach also about hypervisor types? Could we say that if we get all bdms of the instance and one of them have 'multiattach' in the connection info, then we can say we can multi-attach?"}, {'account_id': 15888, 'date': '2019-03-04 12:16:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2019-03-04 14:04:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

Testing completed on the zVM Driver CI system check-nova pipeline and failed.  To recheck only the zVM driver plugins, submit a comment with only  zvm: recheck in the comment.. Contact information: zvmosci@us.ibm.com. For information see https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/ZVMDriver.

- check-nova-master http://extbasicopstackcilog01.podc.sl.edst.ibm.com/test_logs/jenkins-check-nova-master-28606 : FAILURE in 1h 45m 49s'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-04 15:04:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 24:

> Is the multi-attach also about hypervisor types? Could we say that if we get all bdms of the instance and one of them have 'multiattach' in the connection info, then we can say we can multi-attach?

Yes, that's true. The root BDM doesn't need to have a multiattach volume but one of the non-root volumes could be multiattach, so I suppose we need to scan them. But like tags it's a per-driver capability so that's why it's treated similarly in the API."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-03-04 15:05:30.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 26515, 'date': '2019-03-04 15:47:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 24:

For rechecking only on the Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI, add a review comment with run-Cloudbase Nova Hyper-V CI

commit_message:
Detach/Attach root volume API changes

Added support for detaching a root volume and attach a root
volume by specify ``is_root=True`` when attaching. These
actions will be only allowed to perform on instances in
``SHELVED_OFFLOADED`` status. If try to request ``unshelve`` an
instance without root volume, the corresponding API will reply
``HTTP 409``.

Added support for including the ``boot_index`` field in the responses
of:

* POST /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments (attach)
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments (list)
* GET /servers/{server_id}/os-volume_attachments/{volume_id} (show)

Implements: blueprint detach-boot-volume

Change-Id: I759d4a7cce56047d21e91c2135e0414c243f99fd

commit_message:
Fix update share network functional test

After fixing a bug that was allowing share network update when it
shouldn't, the test that validates the share network creation and
update started failing. An additional validation was introduced in
the fix for this bug, and this was this test failure cause. This
patch fixes the test and make it work properly.

Change-Id: Id588ee74ac50b5e63c83df5cde3328861e3f3d76
Closes-Bug: #1849377

commit_message:
Make multi-platform support more maintainable

Avoids use of extensive platform dependenc conditionals inside the
tasks as they easily get out of control when trying to support
multiple distributions and releases.

This patterns allows us to add support for new distributions by
only changing the vars/ configurations.

Based on https://docs.sbarnea.com/ansible/distro-vars

Change-Id: I0b9cfd056338fb0f529b69cf52b405e0fa5368e9

revisions:
[{'created': '2017-12-21 15:01:24.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: Introduce SMM (Systems Management Mode) config class

The SMM[2] hypervisor feature is a prerequisite to support UEFI Secure
Boot with OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware), which is aimed to be
added as a future future[1].

This shows up in a Nova guest XML as:

    ...
    <features>
      <acpi/>
      <apic/>
      <smm state='on'/>
    </features>
    ...

The purpose[3] of SMM in this context is:

    "(virtual) hardware separation between the runtime guest OS and the
    firmware (OVMF), with the intent to make Secure Boot actually
    secure, by preventing the runtime guest OS from tampering with the
    variable store and S3 [meaning: suspend to RAM] areas."

[1] (WIP spec) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/506720/ -- Add ability
    for OVMF Secure Boot
[2] http://wiki.osdev.org/System_Management_Mode
[3] https://github.com/tianocore/edk2/tree/master/OvmfPkg

Change-Id: I1a30d8ed4ebe6c22eefd2d79322a24ae08aa7216

commit_message:
libvirt: Introduce SMM (System Management Mode) config class

The SMM[2] hypervisor feature is a prerequisite to support UEFI Secure
Boot with OVMF (Open Virtual Machine Firmware), which is aimed to be
added as a future future[1].

This shows up in a Nova guest XML as:

    ...
    <features>
      <acpi/>
      <apic/>
      <smm state='on'/>
    </features>
    ...

The purpose[3] of SMM in this context is:

    "(virtual) hardware separation between the runtime guest OS and the
    firmware (OVMF), with the intent to make Secure Boot actually
    secure, by preventing the runtime guest OS from tampering with the
    variable store and S3 [meaning: suspend to RAM] areas."

[1] (WIP spec) https://review.openstack.org/#/c/506720/ -- Add ability
    for OVMF Secure Boot
[2] http://wiki.osdev.org/System_Management_Mode
[3] https://github.com/tianocore/edk2/tree/master/OvmfPkg

Change-Id: I1a30d8ed4ebe6c22eefd2d79322a24ae08aa7216

commit_message:
Correct ovn-dbs upgrade image id variable

In I8b5b25d03b86b2c44b2d47e5a0624e7dd13873da the variable
ovn_dbs_image_id was renamed to old_ovn_dbs_image_id but
one instance of it was left behind. This patch corrects
that.

Related-Bug: #1838971
Closes: rhbz#1758578
Change-Id: I5735210aad47411fdeb62d4dab45b1150ec3ea04

commit_message:
Switch to IPA-builder for building ironic-python-agent

Also update the documentation to purge any mentions of CoreOS images
and the deprecated ironic-agent element.

Change-Id: I09018e451e698a7c6b99106b64c87a526cc959d5

I was right about the incoming XML [1]:

  <memoryBacking>
    <hugepages>
      <page size="2048" unit="KiB" nodeset="0"/>
      <page size="2048" unit="KiB" nodeset="1"/>
    </hugepages>
  </memoryBacking>

How we ended up with a *single* <page> in the outgoing XML [2] is a mystery, I would have expected 2 <pages>s, each with the same nodeset. I checked lxml, it's not swallowing any elements when tostring'ing (at least on my laptop).

In any case, I update the code (including handling the <memory> element in <numatubne>), let's see what happens.

Rest of the experimental job is still running, but nova-nfv-multi-numa-multinod passed [1]. Compute logs at [2], controller logs at [3]. Can't link to specific lines while, but things like "Instance has a NUMA topology, preparing for NUMA live migration" on the controller, and LibvirtLiveMigrateNUMAInfo in the migrate_data on the compute, are appearing in the logs. We don't see the XML, but looking at the libvirt qemu logs, for instance 59c2b488-0798-4323-aee4-2f4ac4f60f68 for example, we can see the hugepages host-node being updated: on the controller [4], it's "mem-path=/dev/hugepages/libvirt/qemu/1-instance-00000001,share=yes,size=134217728,host-nodes=0", on the compute [5] it's "mem-path=/dev/hugepages/libvirt/qemu/1-instance-00000001,share=yes,size=134217728,host-nodes=1"

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-02 14:05:08.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] multi numa nfv testing job

- This change adds two new job definitions for a single and multi node
  nfv job.
- This change adds two new nodeset that target the multi node lables
  "ubuntu-bionic-expanded" provided by fortnebula.

The fortnebula(FN) ubuntu-bionic-expanded lable provide a dual
numa guest with 16G of ram and 8CPU arraned in a toplogy
of 2 sockets each with 2 core each with 2 hyperthreads.

while this might change in the future, combined with the fact that
FN also provides nested vert it allows testing of cpu pinning,
hugepages, multi numa guest, realtime instance and other nfv features.

This job use those feature to add basic first party testing of nfv featuers.
This job can be extended in the future to do more advanced testing by
leveraging the whitebox tempest plugin.

Change-Id: I76ccf842e142ea91890abfb61d44b0725e9ee750
'}, {'created': '2019-09-02 14:08:38.000000000', 'message': '[WIP] multi numa nfv testing job

while this might change in the future, combined with the fact that

The fortnebula(FN) ubuntu-bionic-expanded lable provide a dual
numa guest with 16G of ram and 8CPU arraned in a toplogy
of 2 sockets each with 2 core each with 2 hyperthreads.

while this might change in the future, combined with the fact that
FN also provides nested vert it allows testing of cpu pinning,
hugepages, multi numa guest, realtime instance and other nfv features.

This job use those feature to add basic first party testing of nfv featuers.
This job can be extended in the future to do more advanced testing by
leveraging the whitebox tempest plugin.

commit_message:
multi numa nfv testing job

- This change adds two new job definitions for a single and multi node
  nfv job.
- This change adds two new nodeset that target the multi node lables
  "ubuntu-bionic-expanded" provided by fortnebula.

The fortnebula(FN) ubuntu-bionic-expanded lable provide a dual
numa guest with 16G of ram and 8CPU arraned in a toplogy
of 2 sockets each with 2 core each with 2 hyperthreads.

while this might change in the future, combined with the fact that
FN also provides nested vert it allows testing of cpu pinning,
hugepages, multi numa guest, realtime instance and other nfv features.

This job use those feature to add basic first party testing of nfv featuers.
This job can be extended in the future to do more advanced testing by
leveraging the whitebox tempest plugin.

Depends-on: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/640021/
Change-Id: I76ccf842e142ea91890abfb61d44b0725e9ee750

This will need at least a blueprint to be reviewed and approved before we can merge this. It will need a spec in addition to that, if it turns out to be more complex (a previous same or similar use case has turned out to be complex in the past).

That said, this or something similar to this has been proposed before: https://review.openstack.org/381912 and I'm wondering, is this the same use case and behavior and if not, what is different about this use case and behavior? It would be useful to determine whether the two efforts are aiming to solve the same problem.

Furthermore, at the last PTG [1], there was discussion about the same or similar use case and solving it by using placement request filtering + forbidden traits. I'll ask members of the placement subteam to take a look at this review and add their thoughts.

revisions:
[{'created': '2018-08-17 20:17:25.000000000', 'message': 'Add exact match aggregate image properties matcher/filter

This filter is a variant of the AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation
but is distinct enough that it should likely be its own thing.

The reasoning behind it is that the existing filter is a little
to tolerant of missing image properties (when you really want it
to match exactly) and to setup your aggregates and images with that
filter is very tedious, fragile, and error prone.

So instead of that filter, this filter uses some of the same concepts
but is less tolerant of missing image properties (for example when
you setup a windows only hypervisor set you do not want other images
with various other properties to end up there).

Change-Id: I9ba17489b914edeb7e882380d98ac497ddc0b383

commit_message:
Add exact match aggregate image properties matcher/filter

This filter is a variant of the AggregateImagePropertiesIsolation
but is distinct enough that it should likely be its own thing.

The reasoning behind it is that the existing filter is a little
to tolerant of missing image properties (when you really want it
to match exactly) and to setup your aggregates and images with that
filter is very tedious, fragile, and error prone.

So instead of that filter, this filter uses some of the same concepts
but is less tolerant of missing image properties (for example when
you setup a windows only hypervisor set you do not want other images
with various other properties to end up there).

Co-author: Elancheran Subramanian <esubramanian@godaddy.com>

Change-Id: I9ba17489b914edeb7e882380d98ac497ddc0b383

commit_message:
Update min tox version to 2.0

The commands used by constraints need at least tox 2.0.  Update to
reflect reality, which should help with local running of constraints
targets.

Change-Id: I77a5cbfdb6e58b81618b579c58b2af1aaf849b6c
Closes-Bug:  #1801484

commit_message:
Migrate to Zuul v3 native jobs

This corrects the path handling in the CI and removes a lot of
redundancy in the CI definitions. Also adds fixed log collection
from https://review.opendev.org/#/c/649526/ to make the CI pass.

Removes handling of ZUUL_CHANGES. It is not present in new jobs,
and its use case in Bifrost is completely unclear.

Eventually, we should rewrite the whole test-bifrost.sh in ansible,
but that's a much bigger task.

Change-Id: Id893e816a7806e7d75282628817288d8a34ab8af

commit_message:
Refactor CONTRIBUTING.rst

I've been noticed that this file is very OpenStack generic and doesn't help
contributors to find the Nova-specific documentation about our contributing
process.
Here is a first take of what I think we can document easily without maintaining
too hardly but comments or other patch sets are welcome.

Change-Id: I36cf1d030627101d21cb143a8b900a1c78d19fca

Working on next patch to fix the pep8 issues (now that I've convinced my mac it loves py3) as well as address current comments. Stay tuned :)"}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2018-05-20 14:06:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

(4 comments)

David, awesome start on this. -1 is primarily due to needing a version attribute for the cell specification file so that we build in an ability to evolve the definition of the cell descriptor file contents over time.

I've left a few more suggestions inline for cleaning up the code a bit.

Overall, I'm a big proponent of moving towards a more declarative way of representing inventory -- in fact, I proposed a provider descriptor YAML file in much the same vein for representing compute node device and inventory information: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/550244/

I believe eventually, we'll want Nova and other OpenStack services to follow the larger ecosystem's footsteps and begin treating inventory and configuration information like this in a standardized YAML or JSON declarative style.

Best,

-jay"}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2018-05-20 14:51:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Code-Review-1

So, I'm kind of against adding this to nova-manage. The reason, however, is that I think we made a bit of a miscalculation early on by arranging our data structures being so database-centric. I think we should have made the cell configuration live in the config file, and sort of do what you're doing here as necessary (or perhaps in a bootstrapping command) to get the structure of our records into the database. Specifically, that would end up without things like the credentials in the database.

I've been kinda hoping we could head that direction in the future. I feel like merging this patch and somewhat committing ourselves to the yaml file makes that future less likely or at least less clear. Given we've been trying to make the CRUD operations for these things be idempotent, I think adding a dedicated feature for this kinda encroaches on the puppet/ansible realm.

All that said, if we're going to merge this, I think we need to start a separate module (or modules) for some of the meat of nova-manage, as we've been just piling stuff in it lately and I think we're overdue."}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2018-05-21 16:02:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

(1 comment)

Another thing to consider: nova-manage list_cells --format (yaml|json)'}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2018-06-04 22:28:24.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 23498, 'date': '2018-06-04 23:27:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

I'll propose a patch for this because David is busy."}, {'account_id': 4690, 'date': '2019-04-30 20:11:49.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 5:

*confirmed that the addition of the --update flag would solve the use case and allow them to have ansible apply the necessary configuration by calling 'nova-manage' idempotently."}, {'account_id': 10962, 'date': '2019-04-30 20:19:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5:

Thank you so much :-)'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-30 14:54:32.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned'}]

[{'created': '2018-05-17 00:11:25.000000000', 'message': 'Adding apply_cells to nova-manage to enable automated cells_v2
configuration.

This adds a new apply_cells method to the nova-manage commands that
reads in a specification file (json or yaml) and sets up the
configurations based on the specifications within the file. This
feature matches cell_mappings to specifications based on its name and
will "make-it-so" for cell_mappings by:
* create_cell (spec exists with a name not already in cell_mappings),
* update_cell (name-matched spec-cell_mapping whose properties have different values),
* delete_cell (when spec file does not have a matching name for existing cell).

There is a --dry-run argument that can be used to see what would change
without actually performing any modifications.

This should allow automated systems that want to source control (git or
inventory generated) how their cells are setup and managed.

commit_message:
Add apply_cells to nova-manage

This adds a new apply_cells method to the nova-manage commands that
reads in a specification file (json or yaml) and sets up the
configurations based on the specifications within the file. This
feature matches cell_mappings to specifications based on its name and
will "make-it-so" for cell_mappings by:
* create_cell (spec exists with a name not already in cell_mappings),
* update_cell (spec and mapping exist, but have different values),
* delete_cell (spec file does not have a matching cell by name).

There is a --dry-run argument that can be used to see what would change
without actually performing any modifications.

This should allow automated systems that want to source control (git or
inventory generated) how their cells are setup and managed.

Change-Id: I7a60a02637d85f576d4be6d9ea8a5e2a01360d0c

Some drivers do not support abort. The base driver raises
NotImplementedError for the live_migration_abort. This may
result in the instance state being changed to ERROR which
renders additional operations on the instance as
problematic (until the admin resets the bad state)

The solution to this issues is two fold:
1. Compute virt driver - enable the driver to set a flag
   indicating if it can support abort for a live migration.
   The new flag is supports_live_migration_abort and this is
   False by default. If the compute driver does not support
   the opertaion the compute manager will raise the exception:
   AbortMigrationNotSupported
2. On the API side if the exception AbortMigrationNotSupported is
   raised by the manager then the API server will return
   BadRequest. Prior to this it was getting a random 500.

Closes-bug: #1815466
Change-Id: I9b66765045568033c18b1a5780601e56c4c70e66
'}]
commit_message:
Better handle live migration abort

Some drivers do not support abort. The base driver raises
NotImplementedError for the live_migration_abort. This may
result in the instance state being changed to ERROR which
renders additional operations on the instance as
problematic (until the admin resets the bad state)

The solution to this issues is two fold:
1. Compute virt driver - enable the driver to set a flag
   indicating if it can support abort for a live migration.
   The new flag is supports_live_migration_abort and this is
   False by default. If the compute driver does not support
   the opertaion the compute manager will raise the exception:
   AbortMigrationNotSupported
2. On the API side if the exception AbortMigrationNotSupported is
   raised by the manager then the API server will return
   BadRequest. Prior to this it was getting a random 500.

Closes-bug: #1815466
Change-Id: I9b66765045568033c18b1a5780601e56c4c70e66

messages: [{'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-29 20:36:35.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-29 20:42:41.000000000', 'content': 'Topic changed from use-opensuse-150 to use-opensuse-15'}, {'account_id': 6593, 'date': '2019-10-29 21:56:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1\n\nwhy don't we switch the nodeset to opensuse-15 instead of removing the  job alltogether?"}, {'account_id': 6547, 'date': '2019-10-30 07:13:12.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 28619, 'date': '2019-10-30 12:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 25023, 'date': '2019-10-30 13:36:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-29 20:36:35.000000000', 'message': "Remove opensuse-150 job

Remove the opensuse-150 job, it is not run anymore on master and was
removed there (together with others) since it did not test what it
should test.
We're retiring opensuse-150 in OpenStack Infra, so remove the job
completly on this branch as well.

This is a partial backport of change https://review.opendev.org/660071.

Change-Id: Ia6e1341dd93a2cbf78179d1064b924b4d3126470
"}, {'created': '2019-10-30 07:13:12.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to opensuse-15

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Note this is not a backport, master has changed the job setup completly,
instead it just updates the jobs.

Change-Id: Ia6e1341dd93a2cbf78179d1064b924b4d3126470
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Note this is not a backport, master has changed the job setup completly,
instead it just updates the jobs.

Change-Id: Ia6e1341dd93a2cbf78179d1064b924b4d3126470

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-06-13 14:09:01.000000000', 'message': "Refresh instance network info on deletion

When deleting an instance, if the network info is empty, we should
refresh the info because we can't be sure the copy of the cache we
have when we fetched the instance to delete is up-to-date, i.e. if
we're racing to delete the server while it's building and the
network info cache was updated in the database after we started the
delete operation and got the instance from the DB, then we could
fail to unplug VIFs.

Closes-Bug: #1830081

Change-Id: I99601773406c61f93002e2f7cbb248cf73cef0ab
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>
(cherry picked from commit d4ed0d8b7adc350e8962df033c2da892c95561fe)
"}]
commit_message:
Refresh instance network info on deletion

When deleting an instance, if the network info is empty, we should
refresh the info because we can't be sure the copy of the cache we
have when we fetched the instance to delete is up-to-date, i.e. if
we're racing to delete the server while it's building and the
network info cache was updated in the database after we started the
delete operation and got the instance from the DB, then we could
fail to unplug VIFs.

Closes-Bug: #1830081

Change-Id: I99601773406c61f93002e2f7cbb248cf73cef0ab
Signed-off-by: Arnaud Morin <arnaud.morin@corp.ovh.com>
(cherry picked from commit d4ed0d8b7adc350e8962df033c2da892c95561fe)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 06:09:13.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ia76b107a137a39716253631e5a8d294f7ee9614e
(cherry picked from commit e45d5e3b9259620914ff3e3c5fa67dd23de1879c)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

The new job tempest-full-py3-opensuse15 use the opensuse-15 nodeset,
change tempest-full-py3-opensuse150 to tempest-full-py3-opensuse15.

Change-Id: Ia76b107a137a39716253631e5a8d294f7ee9614e
(cherry picked from commit e45d5e3b9259620914ff3e3c5fa67dd23de1879c)

commit_message:
Log some stats for image pre-cache

This attempts to log some statistics about a precache operation so that,
barring something more complicated on the operator side, there is some
useful information in the logs about what is going on.

Related to blueprint image-precache-support

Change-Id: I550afc344eca30c366ba0e5342966bcbaac96bfe

commit_message:
Fixing copy of all logs in collect test info

Adding sudo to be able to read all the logs under /var/log and
copy them in the final log location.
Adding bifrost as cloud variable to openrc to be able to load
node info correctly in keystone job.

Change-Id: I4fa4449800d7f78f11e6df14b0b346f60a567019

commit_message:
Revert "Workaround for ansible-lint installation failure"

This reverts the disabling of the ansible-lint test from
commit cffd4fc9d41b15c31610dee4abd8786916f5933b and updates
ansible-lint to the fixed version.

Conflicts:
>------tripleo_ansible/roles/tripleo-container-manage/tasks/main.yml

Change-Id: I37100f5e1764a5cd2cb8df82ae963e673ca0a8da
(cherry picked from commit 28e105c05689f3b8fc046758f9218e9ffab51360)

This patch also updates the smoke test to run train.

Hmm, there appears to be some intermittent failure with the novnc stuff so it probably makes a difference where the instance lands, on the controller or subnode:

https://storage.bhs1.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_972/683988/4/check/nova-next/9726aeb/testr_results.html.gz

Comparing the vnc options from the n-cpu.conf in the subnode:

[vnc]
server_proxyclient_address = 10.208.226.196
server_listen = 0.0.0.0
xvpvncproxy_base_url = http://10.208.226.201:6081/console
novncproxy_base_url = http://10.208.226.201:6080/vnc_auto.html

To the controller:

[vnc]
server_proxyclient_address = 10.208.226.201
server_listen = 0.0.0.0
xvpvncproxy_base_url = http://10.208.226.201:6081/console
novncproxy_base_url = http://10.208.226.201:6080/vnc_auto.html

The server_proxyclient_address is going to different places. 10.208.226.196 is the subnode host IP. Seems like this might be related to Id8b0b4159b98c7ff3c85ec3daa03d556d9897ce9 which melwitt recently fixed.

I think the one difference in this job is we're using tls. I don't see the vencrypt stuff configured..."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-22 20:21:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Hmm, looking at the inventory:

https://storage.bhs1.cloud.ovh.net/v1/AUTH_dcaab5e32b234d56b626f72581e3644c/zuul_opendev_logs_972/683988/4/check/nova-next/9726aeb/zuul-info/inventory.yaml

NOVA_CONSOLE_PROXY_COMPUTE_TLS: true

but in devstack it's looking for "True":

https://github.com/openstack/devstack/blob/1a46c898db9c16173013d95e2bc954992121077c/lib/nova#L175

So maybe that's already been broken for a long time.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-22 20:35:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

local.conf looks OK though:

https://zuul.opendev.org/t/openstack/build/9726aebf48804b83bbebe290bd8187ac/log/controller/logs/local_conf.txt.gz#54'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-22 20:51:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-09-23 15:37:36.000000000', 'message': "Make nova-next multinode and drop tempest-slow-py3

The tempest-slow-py3 job is, well, very slow. It takes
over 2.5 hours sometimes to complete. There are a few
reasons beyond it just running slow tests but it runs
all slow tests serially and for nova it's testing things
we don't care about like network scenario tests like
test_slaac_from_os. The one benefit we get from running
tempest-slow-py3 is that it's multinode and there are
certain slow test scenarios for multinode that are
important for test coverage.

This change drops the tempest-slow-py3 job from our
job list and changes nova-next to be multinode. The
nova-next job runs a select set of tempest compute API
and scenario tests only and runs them concurrently, which
in the gate is 4 workers at a time. The nova-next job
will take a bit longer since we have to setup the subnode
now but overall it should still be faster than the
tempest-slow-py3 job and we'll save on one more node
required from nodepool to run jobs against nova changes.

The USE_PYTHON3 variable can be dropped from the nova-next
job definition now that it extends tempest-multinode-full-py3.

Change-Id: I1b7d71e833bf0743f22d7fa0241c9d1bbcd0faac

commit_message:
Make nova-next multinode and drop tempest-slow-py3

The tempest-slow-py3 job is, well, very slow. It takes
over 2.5 hours sometimes to complete. There are a few
reasons beyond it just running slow tests but it runs
all slow tests serially and for nova it's testing things
we don't care about like network scenario tests like
test_slaac_from_os. The one benefit we get from running
tempest-slow-py3 is that it's multinode and there are
certain slow test scenarios for multinode that are
important for test coverage.

This change drops the tempest-slow-py3 job from our
job list and changes nova-next to be multinode. The
nova-next job runs a select set of tempest compute API
and scenario tests only and runs them concurrently, which
in the gate is 4 workers at a time. The nova-next job
will take a bit longer since we have to setup the subnode
now but overall it should still be faster than the
tempest-slow-py3 job and we'll save on one more node
required from nodepool to run jobs against nova changes.

The USE_PYTHON3 variable can be dropped from the nova-next
job definition now that it extends tempest-multinode-full-py3.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/690469/

Change-Id: I1b7d71e833bf0743f22d7fa0241c9d1bbcd0faac

commit_message:
Upgrade pylint&astroid to a version that works with python3.7

1. Astroid and pylint are tightly coupled,so both versions should be specified for python3.7

2. A few rules are added to the ignore list in .pylintrc

Change-Id: Ice65c8fa94a2de2c0365ec5ab710d93675aacbb9

[{'created': '2019-10-07 14:00:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fixes multi-registry config in Quobyte driver

This closes a bug concerning multi-registry configurations
for Quobyte volumes due to no longer using the is_mounted()
method that failed in that case.
Besides, this adds exception handling for the unmount call that
is issued on trying to mount an already mounted volume.

NOTE: The original commit also added a new feature (fs type
based validation) which is omitted in this backport.

Closes-Bug: #1737131

Change-Id: Ia5a23ce1123a68608ee2ec6f2ac5dca02da67c59
(cherry picked from commit 05a73c0f3a9f8edf9024f9870279bc6fb7bba2e7)
(cherry picked from commit 656aa1cd40570154df606484d31616989b5296aa)
(cherry picked from commit c958ad8a68ea9a8ea465d9e3dd889248d9f42481)
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes multi-registry config in Quobyte driver

This closes a bug concerning multi-registry configurations
for Quobyte volumes due to no longer using the is_mounted()
method that failed in that case.
Besides, this adds exception handling for the unmount call that
is issued on trying to mount an already mounted volume.

NOTE: The original commit also added a new feature (fs type
based validation) which is omitted in this backport.

Closes-Bug: #1737131

Change-Id: Ia5a23ce1123a68608ee2ec6f2ac5dca02da67c59
(cherry picked from commit 05a73c0f3a9f8edf9024f9870279bc6fb7bba2e7)
(cherry picked from commit 656aa1cd40570154df606484d31616989b5296aa)
(cherry picked from commit c958ad8a68ea9a8ea465d9e3dd889248d9f42481)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-18 14:05:29.000000000', 'message': 'Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Update all jobs. There were already a few opensuse-15 jobs, so remove
some opensuse-150 jobs since we can use the -15 ones instead.

Change-Id: I695b07933ffcbdf51213442155a9a0e2eab12bbc
'}]
commit_message:
Switch to opensuse-15 nodeset

opensuse-150 nodeset is referring to openSUSE 15.0, which is still in
maintenance but openSUSE 15.1 has been released already. "opensuse-15"
is going to refer to the "latest openSUSE 15.x" build released and
working for OpenStack going forward, so add this nodeset and use
it by default going forward.

Update all jobs. There were already a few opensuse-15 jobs, so remove
some opensuse-150 jobs since we can use the -15 ones instead.

Change-Id: I695b07933ffcbdf51213442155a9a0e2eab12bbc

commit_message:
Remove broken experimental job

Change I270c0b623aef55bd6bf80b9bf5fdd618e4ced517 removed the job
definition for openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_metal_octavia-opensuse-150,
remove the experimental job now.

The template openstack-ansible-deploy-aio_metal-jobs tests openSUSE, so
no need for this job.

Change-Id: I0431e693efde35e933bf2f7c6bcedec326aac2f7
(cherry picked from commit e75d43a90574efa5f383475f3e60130d7de9b9e7)

commit_message:
Apply validation on designate zone prefix values

This patch applies validation on values ipv4-ptr-zone-prefix-size and
ipv6-ptr-zone-prefix-size to prevent users from choosing values not
supported by Neutron's Designate driver.

Change-Id: I6f2d5c9d1a3f16242263f11b1f999ab7ec3a4266
Signed-off-by: Stamatis Katsaounis <katsaouniss@gmail.com>

In current tempest.yaml playbook, tempest_blacklist tests
gets generated from skip list for both undercloud and overcloud
leading to skipping other tests which were suppose to run.

In order to fix, generate the tempest_blacklist for overcloud
which is skipped in standalone and overcloud deployment.

commit_message:
[os_tempest] Generate skiplist only for overcloud

In current tempest.yaml playbook, tempest_blacklist tests
gets generated from skip list for both undercloud and overcloud
leading to skipping other tests which were suppose to run.

In order to fix, generate the tempest_blacklist for overcloud
which is skipped in standalone and overcloud deployment.

Change-Id: Ibada4e4ea46100f303f76e378d59b02008ad3104
Co-Authored-By: Arx Cruz <arxcruz@redhat.com>
Signed-off-by: Chandan Kumar (raukadah) <chkumar@redhat.com>

Evaluate input expression should check the in_context

The workflow in the test fails because contextView
does not evaluate in_context

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-29 09:41:16.000000000', 'message': 'Include nova::availability_zone in nova::api and nova::conductor

For some reason this was included in nova::compute and nova::scheduler
but never included in nova::api eventhough bug #1529065 specifically
calls out the fact that it is missing.

Looking at the code - nova-api definitely requires it.
E.g the server create request handler sets the target AZ to
CONF.default_schedule_zone if none
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/queens/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L486

and the az request handler skips the internal_service_availabily_zone
when listing AZs
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/queens/nova/api/openstack/compute/availability_zone.py#L38

nova-conductor also requires it as it calls
availability_zones.get_host_availability_zone which defaults to
CONF.default_availability_zone

commit_message:
Include nova::availability_zone in nova::api and nova::conductor

For some reason this was included in nova::compute and nova::scheduler
but never included in nova::api eventhough bug #1529065 specifically
calls out the fact that it is missing.

Looking at the code - nova-api definitely requires it.
E.g the server create request handler sets the target AZ to
CONF.default_schedule_zone if none
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/queens/nova/api/openstack/compute/servers.py#L486

and the az request handler skips the internal_service_availabily_zone
when listing AZs
https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/stable/queens/nova/api/openstack/compute/availability_zone.py#L38

nova-conductor also requires it as it calls
availability_zones.get_host_availability_zone which defaults to
CONF.default_availability_zone

Change-Id: If4d6a4a8f4cc1e7066cacb00da67d5433acd6ac5
Closes-bug: #1529065
(cherry picked from commit d7eb253e4de03c05eb6597db0959e4137831ad91)
(cherry picked from commit 57ff2a154c0e50da4a833ffabfef27a8d0db4fb6)
(cherry picked from commit 75d67bd6c8ff0fd147e1ac7516ede2bc60d960b2)
(cherry picked from commit effda25202c9270b843e113c12edef5b80130559)

commit_message:
Fix pbr for RDO

There is a python2-pbr package provided by the Fedora distro, so
the generated package conflicts with it. Fixing it by making
python-pbr provide and obsolete it.

Change-Id: I4705a27afd9f992ff71654c29f4ee349f8a0178b

commit_message:
Remove openSUSE 15 jobs

openSUSE does not support lxc, remove all jobs.
There's no value testing a use case that will not work.

Change-Id: I1a8b7ec942eb594c669c3feb0f2b6db159d8b909
(cherry picked from commit 7cdb2d1ac34f20b6369252c98c181f66b40d7667)

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-29 18:40:39.000000000', 'message': 'List the Ussuri cycle signing key as current

This sets the end date for the Train key, adds the Ussuri key
starting today and links to a minimal export of the corresponding
public key and its details on the keyserver network. This can be
amended with a new patchset or a follow-up change to correct the
included dates after the key material change (Depends-On below)
merges and goes into effect.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/691939
Change-Id: Id8e4d24fa18cccffb2da3acd987cfbf01efd3bae
'}]
commit_message:
List the Ussuri cycle signing key as current

This sets the end date for the Train key, adds the Ussuri key
starting today and links to a minimal export of the corresponding
public key and its details on the keyserver network. This can be
amended with a new patchset or a follow-up change to correct the
included dates after the key material change (Depends-On below)
merges and goes into effect.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/691939
Change-Id: Id8e4d24fa18cccffb2da3acd987cfbf01efd3bae

subject: Workaround rhel8,0 iptables bug causing neutron_ovs_agent to restart continuously
messages:
[{'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-10-30 09:29:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 20172, 'date': '2019-10-30 09:34:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

you sure this is a cherry-pick the code is completely different from the version in master where we have:

              - name: Run iptables -t raw -L to workaround a rhel8.0 bug (remove once rhbz#1673609 is fixed)
                shell: |
                  iptables -t raw -nL
                  ip6tables -t raw -nL'}, {'account_id': 29222, 'date': '2019-10-30 09:40:07.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned

Already merged.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 09:29:36.000000000', 'message': 'Workaround rhel8,0 iptables bug causing neutron_ovs_agent to restart continuously

On rhel8 the ovs_neutron_agent container endlessly restarts with:

2019-03-05 15:41:57.096 534226 DEBUG oslo_concurrency.lockutils [req-a004e117-dba8-42bf-81fe-abf7a9f2faab - - - - -] Lock "conntrack" released by "neutron.agent.linux.ip_conntrack.get_conntrack" :: held 0.257s inner /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:339
2019-03-05 15:41:57.096 534226 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-a004e117-dba8-42bf-81fe-abf7a9f2faab - - - - -] Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: Table `raw' does not exist
; Stderr:  Agent terminated!: neutron_lib.exceptions.ProcessExecutionError: Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: Table `raw' does not exist
2019-03-05 15:41:57.098 534226 INFO oslo_rootwrap.client [-] Stopping rootwrap daemon process with pid=534237

This is due to an iptables bug listing tables that were not initialized:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1673609

Let us just load the raw module by listing it so that the issue does not
appear. Slawomir and I tested this on an environment and could confirm
that the agent does not restart any longer:
[root@undercloud-0 ~]# podman logs neutron_ovs_agent 2>&1|grep -i error
[root@undercloud-0 ~]#

We are leaving these commands running on any OS version as they are
harmless in any case.

Closes-Bug: #1818834

Co-Authored-By: Slawomir Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ifddcec009ae93ad0e51abfe1425eb81c1817db55
(cherry picked from commit b1d82e6acbc79d9db1a54d53cd178080b72d0845)
'}]
commit_message:
Workaround rhel8,0 iptables bug causing neutron_ovs_agent to restart continuously

On rhel8 the ovs_neutron_agent container endlessly restarts with:

2019-03-05 15:41:57.096 534226 DEBUG oslo_concurrency.lockutils [req-a004e117-dba8-42bf-81fe-abf7a9f2faab - - - - -] Lock "conntrack" released by "neutron.agent.linux.ip_conntrack.get_conntrack" :: held 0.257s inner /usr/lib/python3.6/site-packages/oslo_concurrency/lockutils.py:339
2019-03-05 15:41:57.096 534226 ERROR neutron.plugins.ml2.drivers.openvswitch.agent.ovs_neutron_agent [req-a004e117-dba8-42bf-81fe-abf7a9f2faab - - - - -] Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: Table `raw' does not exist
; Stderr:  Agent terminated!: neutron_lib.exceptions.ProcessExecutionError: Exit code: 1; Stdin: ; Stdout: Table `raw' does not exist
2019-03-05 15:41:57.098 534226 INFO oslo_rootwrap.client [-] Stopping rootwrap daemon process with pid=534237

This is due to an iptables bug listing tables that were not initialized:
https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1673609

Let us just load the raw module by listing it so that the issue does not
appear. Slawomir and I tested this on an environment and could confirm
that the agent does not restart any longer:
[root@undercloud-0 ~]# podman logs neutron_ovs_agent 2>&1|grep -i error
[root@undercloud-0 ~]#

We are leaving these commands running on any OS version as they are
harmless in any case.

Closes-Bug: #1818834

Co-Authored-By: Slawomir Kaplonski <skaplons@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Ifddcec009ae93ad0e51abfe1425eb81c1817db55
(cherry picked from commit b1d82e6acbc79d9db1a54d53cd178080b72d0845)

subject: Fix fip address display for loadbalancer
messages: [{'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2019-10-30 08:05:53.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked from branch master.'}, {'account_id': 2245, 'date': '2019-10-30 08:54:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 6469, 'date': '2019-10-30 09:23:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-30 08:05:53.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fip address display for loadbalancer

Currently add_floating_ip_info find floating ip based on match of
floating ip fixed address and VIP ip address which is not correct
for all cases. We may have several private subnets with same ip
range accross the tenant and occasionally loadbalancers may have
the  same VIP ip address, though ports are different.

Fix this case by comparison of ids instead of addresses.

Change-Id: Ie6ac381bb63149248fcb2f710348f97b6f68bec1
(cherry picked from commit fe4df4319b505575baa86fbc3656f87dd252de78)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fip address display for loadbalancer

Currently add_floating_ip_info find floating ip based on match of
floating ip fixed address and VIP ip address which is not correct
for all cases. We may have several private subnets with same ip
range accross the tenant and occasionally loadbalancers may have
the  same VIP ip address, though ports are different.

Fix this case by comparison of ids instead of addresses.

Change-Id: Ie6ac381bb63149248fcb2f710348f97b6f68bec1
(cherry picked from commit fe4df4319b505575baa86fbc3656f87dd252de78)

commit_message:
Don't download image when it's already there

As image should have been already cached in CI [1], we shouldn't
download it again but just verify the checksum.

NOTE - at the time of this commit download.cirros.com is not working
so the cirros image is also switched to 0.4.0 which is present in
the infra CI image.

[1] https://opendev.org/openstack/openstack-ansible/src/branch/master/tests/roles/bootstrap-host/templates/user_variables.aio.yml.j2#L226

(cherry-picked from commit ad4841f70a0ad4ed8090fc3f4c83812204cb59c0)
Change-Id: Ib764c70e483513bec5bd97d4499e67beb4501826

commit_message:
Use Horizon project template for django jobs

Horizon defined a project template 'horizon-non-primary-django-jobs'
for django jobs. This patch use that template to run django jobs
here and fix the failed test cases for django2.2 support by replacing
None with an empty string and add renderer argument.
For information please refer [1], [2], [3].

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/681969/
[2] https://github.com/django/django/commit/6fe9c45b725
[3] https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.1/releases/2.1/#features-removed-in-2-1
Change-Id: I9a62bb0a56b16cd6caa6cc9bf7db9b85c99ed580

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-29 11:59:38.000000000', 'message': 'Fix fip address display for loadbalancer

Currently add_floating_ip_info find floating ip based on match of
floating ip fixed address and VIP ip address which is not correct
for all cases. We may have several private subnets with same ip
range accross the tenant and occasionally loadbalancers may have
the  same VIP ip address, though ports are different.

Fix this case by comparison of ids instead of addresses.

Change-Id: Ie6ac381bb63149248fcb2f710348f97b6f68bec1
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fip address display for loadbalancer

Currently add_floating_ip_info find floating ip based on match of
floating ip fixed address and VIP ip address which is not correct
for all cases. We may have several private subnets with same ip
range accross the tenant and occasionally loadbalancers may have
the  same VIP ip address, though ports are different.

Fix this case by comparison of ids instead of addresses.

Change-Id: Ie6ac381bb63149248fcb2f710348f97b6f68bec1

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-21 14:13:46.000000000', 'message': 'Adoption of microversion-parse by Oslo team

A recent review of the OpenStack namespace yielded a library that
no project team owns, and yet is specific to openstack and present
in global-requirements: microversion-parse.

After discussing it with cdent, and since it is openstack-specific
and depended on by most openstack projects, it feels like Oslo would
be a good home for it. It would follow an "independent" release model
and I don't think it would trigger much updates or maintenance.

Change-Id: I50f543083b2d1286d4fcf9896b22ef42ad763c04
'}]
commit_message:
Adoption of microversion-parse by Oslo team

A recent review of the OpenStack namespace yielded a library that
no project team owns, and yet is specific to openstack and present
in global-requirements: microversion-parse.

After discussing it with cdent, and since it is openstack-specific
and depended on by most openstack projects, it feels like Oslo would
be a good home for it. It would follow an "independent" release model
and I don't think it would trigger much updates or maintenance.

Change-Id: I50f543083b2d1286d4fcf9896b22ef42ad763c04

As part of Train community goal 'Support IPv6-Only Deployments and Testing'[1],
