commit_message:
Update master for stable/train

Add file to the reno documentation build to show release notes for
stable/train.

Use pbr instruction to increment the minor version number
automatically so that master versions are higher than the versions on
stable/train.

Change-Id: I93da104660009f8780852410cfb6f1a5ababbd37
Sem-Ver: feature

commit_message:
update manual_installation.rst for vnf package

In case of manual installation, we needs to create:
1: vnf package csar extract path (i.e. /var/lib/tacker/vnfpackages),
where csar file will be unzip.
2: A shared glance filesystem store path(i.e. /var/lib/tacker/csar_files).

Change-Id: Iffe9d7b22e0297cdedf3212a6120bc9454658297

[{'created': '2019-10-23 07:47:49.000000000', 'message': 'Simplify octavia post deploy configs

Consolidate post deploy configurations in a single file. Octavia
controller services share many configurations. It is best to consolidate
them in the same configuration file. This fixes problems seen like
amphorae not having the controller_ip_port_list config value set on
failover triggered by the Health Manager service as that config was only
being loaded for the Worker service.

Closes-Bug: #1836074
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689872/

Change-Id: I32524f85ef6a0ca3e87fa9acc8c9e12776225717
(cherry picked from commit c2bb9c0937852d1d5488bc727983fce3435ca898)

commit_message:
Simplify octavia post deploy configs

Consolidate post deploy configurations in a single file. Octavia
controller services share many configurations. It is best to consolidate
them in the same configuration file. This fixes problems seen like
amphorae not having the controller_ip_port_list config value set on
failover triggered by the Health Manager service as that config was only
being loaded for the Worker service.

Closes-Bug: #1836074
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/689872/

Change-Id: I32524f85ef6a0ca3e87fa9acc8c9e12776225717
(cherry picked from commit c2bb9c0937852d1d5488bc727983fce3435ca898)

[{'created': '2019-10-23 17:53:24.000000000', 'message': 'Check dnsmasq process is active when spawned

After spawning the "dnsmaqs" process in the method
"Dnsmasq._spawn_or_reload_process", we need to check that the "dnsmasq"
process is running and could be detected by the ProcessManager instance
controlling it.

ProcessManager determines if a process is "active":
- If the network ID is in the cmdline used to execute the process.
- If the process is detected by psutil.Process(pid), returning the
  cmdline needed in the first condition.
- If the PID file exists; this is written by the dnsmasq process
  once is started and is needed in the second condition.

To make this feature available for any other process using
ProcessManager, the implementation is done in this class.

Change-Id: I51dc9d342c613afcbcfdc50a1d2811502748f170
Closes-Bug: #1849502

commit_message:
Check dnsmasq process is active when spawned

After spawning the "dnsmasq" process in the method
"Dnsmasq._spawn_or_reload_process", we need to check that the "dnsmasq"
process is running and could be detected by the ProcessManager instance
controlling it.

ProcessManager determines if a process is "active":
- If the network ID is in the cmdline used to execute the process.
- If the process is detected by psutil.Process(pid), returning the
  cmdline needed in the first condition.
- If the PID file exists; this is written by the dnsmasq process
  once is started and is needed in the second condition.

To make this feature available for any other process using
ProcessManager, the implementation is done in this class.

Change-Id: I51dc9d342c613afcbcfdc50a1d2811502748f170
Closes-Bug: #1849502

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer

commit_message:
Switch to the opensuse-15 nodeset

We are trying to deprecate the opensuse-150 label type in favor of the
opensuse-15 label. The reason for this is opensuse 15, like centos,
doesn't support its older point releases and instead expects users to
keep up to date on its minor updates. This allows us to carry one fewer
image in opendev and ensures we are testing supported releases.

Change-Id: Ice742c370aa5fa1484168496183c5a65ac6b0ee0

commit_message:
Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which can
not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively maintained
and has the right version.

[1]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/rabbitmq
[2]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/rabbitmq

Change-Id: Ie546efe18f8e3886bbc59ddb3573864f379d929a
Closes-Bug: #1850236

Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which can
not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively maintained
and has the right version.

commit_message:
Deprecates the existing "ironic-agent" element in DIB

The "ironic-agent" is copied to ironic-python-agent-builder and
hence it is deprecated from DIB.

Remove from functional testing

Change-Id: Ibc4f75b9d7e2a31994fc86d05bd57975f00fb74f
Task: 36198
Story: 2005114

commit_message:
tripleo-common - blaclist 11.3.0

We cut a release with a backwards incompatible change around the
get_undercloud_registry function that is causing tripleoclient docs
jobs to fail. We need to blacklist 11.3.0. We need to blacklist
11.3.0 and change upper-constraint to 11.3.1.

Related-Bug: #1849788
Change-Id: Id1f7e86dd5533684a4d81dcff60cf021bd64f35f

Fix rabbitmq dependency

puppetlabs/rabbitmq [1] is deprecated, and max version is 5.6.0 which can
not be fulfilled by this dependency.

Correct it to puppet-rabbitmq [2] instead which is being actively maintained
and has the right version.

[1]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppetlabs/rabbitmq
[2]: https://forge.puppet.com/puppet/rabbitmq

commit_message:
Add update share-type API to Share Types

Currently, only the name and description and public access of share-type
is set when the share-type is created, and not allowed to be edited after
the share-type is created. We can only set extra spec for share-type.
But not name or description or public access for share-type.

Previously-approved: Train

Implements: blueprint update-share-type-name-or-description

Change-Id: Ic230cd0544c7e5416394a71bab99ba38ed5d1d54

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 18:25:35.000000000', 'message': 'Add tripleo-hosts-entries role

Add a new role to manage /etc/hosts entries. Instead of these entries
being calculated by Heat, a jinja2 expression is used to construct the
individual hosts entries for each overcloud nodes.

Some data still comes out of Heat, such as those undercloud and extra
hosts entries used for multi-stack. As such, variables are used for

commit_message:
Add tripleo-hosts-entries role

Add a new role to manage /etc/hosts entries. Instead of these entries
being calculated by Heat, a jinja2 expression is used to construct the
individual hosts entries for each overcloud nodes.

Some data still comes out of Heat, such as those for the undercloud,
vips, and extra hosts entries used for multi-stack. As such, variables
are used for these entries so that the role can add them to /etc/hosts.

Change-Id: I1e12962e2f2fa6c1a2b429a3e02424fd42b0a08d

commit_message:
Revert "Remove roles symlink"

This reverts commit 196a5043b9676e7b7d5a5b0c15a338b4d61aa639.

This breaks RDO jobs because they assume the roles dir.

https://github.com/rdo-infra/review.rdoproject.org-config/commit/aca1107d42d76311bb46392ca5925550aa025557. 

We'll need to go with https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691716/ for now.

commit_message:
Drop unnecessary tripleo_ prefix from skeleton role

This patch updates the skeleton role to not add the unnecessary
"tripleo_" prefix when a role name already starts with "tripleo-".

Also updates the generated roles that were affected by this change.

Change-Id: Ib1f604a098cc5d7e8c1a5aa5fe2c8e339e263c91

commit_message:
Fix typo in skeleton role

affected.

Note that the tripleo-packages and tripleo-ovs-dpdk roles are excluded
from being updated because those CI jobs are presently failing.

[{'created': '2019-10-28 15:56:24.000000000', 'message': "Ingress: Move ingress objects back to the extensions api

This updates the ingress objects to move them back to the
extensions API.  While 1.16 moves them under the networking
api, they're still rendered and deployed as extensions/ objects.
This move prevents issues from arising where older versions of
kubernetes might still be deployed during an upgrade, as the
move to the networking API is nonfunctional at this time

Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

This move prevents issues from arising where older versions of

commit_message:
Ingress: Move ingress objects back to the extensions api

This updates the ingress objects to move them back to the
extensions API.  While 1.16 moves them under the networking
api, they're still rendered and deployed as extensions/ objects.
This move prevents issues from arising where older versions of
kubernetes might still be deployed during an upgrade, as the
move to the networking API is nonfunctional at this time

Change-Id: I814bbc833b5b9f79f34aefc60b9c1f9890bca826
Signed-off-by: Steve Wilkerson <sw5822@att.com>

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7769, 'name': 'Pentheus', 'display_name': 'Alan Meadows', 'email': 'alan.meadows@gmail.com', 'username': 'alanmeadows'}, {'_account_id': 8898, 'name': 'Chris Wedgwood', 'email': 'cw@f00f.org', 'username': 'anticw'}, {'_account_id': 16353, 'name': 'Georg Kunz', 'email': 'georg.kunz@ericsson.com', 'username': 'georg-kunz'}, {'_account_id': 16881, 'name': 'Munish', 'email': 'mm6021@att.com', 'username': 'munish.mehan@att.com'}, {'_account_id': 18250, 'name': 'Roy Tang', 'email': 'roy.s.tang@att.com', 'username': 'rt7380'}, {'_account_id': 18256, 'name': 'Hemachandra Reddy', 'email': 'hemachandra.reddy@att.com', 'username': 'hr858f'}, {'_account_id': 21420, 'name': 'Gage Hugo', 'email': 'gagehugo@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghugo'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23928, 'name': 'Pete Birley', 'email': 'petebirley@gmail.com', 'username': 'portdirect'}, {'_account_id': 27589, 'name': 'Deepak Tiwari', 'email': 'deepak.tiwari@aricent.com', 'username': 'deepak.tiwari'}, {'_account_id': 28719, 'name': 'Phil Sphicas', 'email': 'phil.sphicas@att.com', 'username': 'ps3910'}, {'_account_id': 29220, 'name': 'Deepak Tiwari', 'email': 'dt967u@att.com'}]
messages:
[{'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-10-24 21:47:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-10-24 21:48:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-10-24 21:50:42.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3: Commit message was updated.'}, {'account_id': 18250, 'date': '2019-10-24 21:54:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 18256, 'date': '2019-10-24 22:01:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 27589, 'date': '2019-10-24 23:14:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16353, 'date': '2019-10-25 12:10:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 16881, 'date': '2019-10-25 15:15:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 7769, 'date': '2019-10-25 22:53:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2

While I am fine with this change, I am not sure the comment fully articulates the complete value that neutron-sanity-check was providing.  It also ensured that prior to letting the agent start, we felt halfway sure that OVS was functioning properly.  I do not recall the full list of what sanity check does but its a good precursor to catching some potential issues before they become hard-to-debug OpenStack issues.  That said, it is true that better dependency management now exists so the primary reason this existed isn't as relevant.  Given it has issues in queens, and probably isn't maintained all that well, I'm fine to see it go.  For posterity, the other option would be to conditionally check only if ovs-dpdk is not in use however, I'm good with removing it entirely at this point due to the previous two concerns."}, {'account_id': 21420, 'date': '2019-10-28 17:06:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+1'}, {'account_id': 8898, 'date': '2019-10-28 18:55:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 28719, 'date': '2019-10-28 20:49:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

recheck'}]

commit_message:
neutron-ovs-agent-init: remove neutron-sanity-check

This change removes neutron-sanity-check from neutron-ovs-agent-init.
Proper dependencies now exist, as outlined in the original issue [0],
and the check is no longer required.

[0] https://github.com/att-comdev/openstack-helm/issues/88#issuecomment-270829530]

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/691035/
Change-Id: I6f8849ea519da76ac5289e86dbc7beb57cc9baba
Related-Bug: #1842517

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-28 18:33:11.000000000', 'message': "Exclude sushy 1.9.0

sushy 1.9.0 contains critical Redfish message registry bugs which cause
the Ironic generic 'redfish' hardware type (driver) to not work against
at least some Dell EMC hardware.

More specifically, it causes all generic Ironic driver interface
implementations which use the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF)
Redfish protocol, including 'redfish*' and 'idrac-redfish*', to not
work. Those interface implementations are supported by the generic
'redfish' and 'idrac' drivers, respectively.

Story: 2006702
Task: 37317
Change-Id: I0efe08b1d10bde8ce06314eb84bae0286ce75e21
"}]
commit_message:
Exclude sushy 1.9.0

sushy 1.9.0 contains critical Redfish message registry bugs which cause
the Ironic generic 'redfish' hardware type (driver) to not work against
at least some Dell EMC hardware.

More specifically, it causes all generic Ironic driver interface
implementations which use the Distributed Management Task Force (DMTF)
Redfish protocol, including 'redfish*' and 'idrac-redfish*', to not
work. Those interface implementations are supported by the generic
'redfish' and 'idrac' drivers, respectively.

Story: 2006702
Task: 37317
Change-Id: I0efe08b1d10bde8ce06314eb84bae0286ce75e21

commit_message:
Change default value for keymgr_backend to default

This changes the default value for keymgr_backend to
the service default from the invalid value [1] that
is used now.

Since Stein and after stevedore fails to load that
class [2].

[1] cinder.keymgr.conf_key_mgr.ConfKeyManager
[2] http://paste.openstack.org/show/782285/

Change-Id: I67ddc2e5a090c99ef2fad64348fcec705b773afa
(cherry picked from commit 235fe651dd08cbd631aaa89d59c26cace1f1b057)

[{'created': '2019-09-24 09:58:07.000000000', 'message': "nvmeof: Fix broken UTs

This patch fixes broken nvmeof UTs. A few tests
called 'asert_called_once_with' method on mock object,
instead of calling 'assert_called_once_with'.
The mistake went undetected, because mock objects
were not configured to use auto-speccing.
To avoid the same problem in the future, configure all
mocks to use autospec.

Additionally, replace 'assert_not_called' method which
is not available on older versions of Python and caused
lower-constraints testenv to fail.

Change-Id: I54a91dfcfae774b1051662291afe1586e59901ac
Signed-off-by: Szczerbik, Przemyslaw <przemyslawx.szczerbik@intel.com>
"}, {'created': '2019-10-17 05:43:00.000000000', 'message': "nvmeof: Fix broken UTs

commit_message:
nvmeof: Fix broken UTs

This patch fixes broken nvmeof UTs. A few tests
called 'asert_called_once_with' method on mock object,
instead of calling 'assert_called_once_with'.
The mistake went undetected, because mock objects
were not configured to use auto-speccing.
To avoid the same problem in the future, configure all
mocks to use autospec.

Additionally, replace 'assert_not_called' method which
is not available on older versions of Python and caused
lower-constraints testenv to fail.

Change-Id: I54a91dfcfae774b1051662291afe1586e59901ac
Signed-off-by: Szczerbik, Przemyslaw <przemyslawx.szczerbik@intel.com>

commit_message:
Remove roles symlink

Zuul currently breaks because it finds a roles location in the repo and
tries to load things from it. See also
https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691716/

commit_message:
Handle IPv6 addresses in ironic_pxe_tftp healthcheck

Use the bind_host value in hiera which can be IPv4
or IPv6.  The IPv6 address is already bracketed.

Change-Id: If09f7732ebd63d461ac760ddadcfbd50b7954dbd
Closes-Bug: 1848615
(cherry picked from commit ce58ac1cb7994a9b1bac7e146320b12bf4026fbf)

commit_message:
Add docs build to openstackclient-plugin-jobs template

Not all plugin projects sphinx-build their docs in such a way that they
build the argparse option helps. However, this is how OSC generates
plugin docs, so we can't have plugin projects merging patches with
option helps that will break the OSC docs.

This commit puts the doc build into the openstackclient-plugin-jobs
template so that plugin projects have to have buildable opt helps in
order to merge.

(Note that we're still not publishing these docs.)

Change-Id: Iff59797d8596b842ede4eb84457a77ff010d4bed

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-24 15:17:45.000000000', 'message': "Fix kolla-bootstrap-servers with docker_storage_driver set

If docker_storage_driver is set in globals.yml, then kolla-ansible
bootstrap-servers is run, it fails like so:

The conditional check 'docker_storage_driver' failed. The error was: error
while evaluating conditional (docker_storage_driver): 'devicemapper' is
undefined

Ansible does not like evaluating strings as conditionals. This change switches
to using the length filter.

Change-Id: Ib95cbdac2a659e7a0d5f113fe48046de3a39dcda
Closes-Bug: #1849691
"}]
commit_message:
Fix kolla-bootstrap-servers with docker_storage_driver set

If docker_storage_driver is set in globals.yml, then kolla-ansible
bootstrap-servers is run, it fails like so:

The conditional check 'docker_storage_driver' failed. The error was: error
while evaluating conditional (docker_storage_driver): 'devicemapper' is
undefined

Ansible does not like evaluating strings as conditionals. This change switches
to using the length filter.

Change-Id: Ib95cbdac2a659e7a0d5f113fe48046de3a39dcda
Closes-Bug: #1849691

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-08-13 22:41:32.000000000', 'message': 'rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

NOTE(mriedem): The tests need to be modified slightly since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a is not in Queens
so _copy_resources is wrapped to set ComputeNode.uuid.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
(cherry picked from commit 648770bd6897aa2ec95df3ec55344d5803543f07)

commit_message:
rt: only map compute node if we created it

If ComputeNode.create() fails, the update_available_resource
periodic will not try to create it again because it will be
mapped in the compute_nodes dict and _init_compute_node will
return early but trying to save changes to that ComputeNode
object later will fail because there is no id on the object,
since we failed to create it in the DB.

This simply reverses the logic such that we only map the
compute node if we successfully created it.

Some existing _init_compute_node testing had to be changed
since it relied on the order of when the ComputeNode object
is created and put into the compute_nodes dict in order
to pass the object along to some much lower-level PCI
tracker code, which was arguably mocking too deep for a unit
test. That is changed to avoid the low-level mocking and
assertions and just assert that _setup_pci_tracker is called
as expected.

NOTE(mriedem): The tests need to be modified slightly since
Ia69fabce8e7fd7de101e291fe133c6f5f5f7056a is not in Queens
so _copy_resources is wrapped to set ComputeNode.uuid.

Change-Id: I9fa1d509a3de405d6246fb8670612c65c10cc93b
Closes-Bug: #1839674
(cherry picked from commit f578146f372386e1889561cba33e95495e66ce97)
(cherry picked from commit 648770bd6897aa2ec95df3ec55344d5803543f07)
(cherry picked from commit 35273a844ab2dc2494f0166d9b8228ee302acd4f)

commit_message:
Categorize mistral-dashboard into horizon-plugin

mistral-dashboard is the only deliverable which is not marked as
horizon-plugin now. This commit moves mistral-dashboard to separate
deliberable files.

Change-Id: I457f377f841858f591c18ae2c17c0764e523d150

commit_message:
Add notification sample test for aggregate.cache_images.start|end

This adds the functional notification sample test for the
aggregate.cache_images.start and aggregate.cache_images.end
versioned notifications.

I also added a comment to the docs builder code since it took
me a bit to figure out how to get the notification sample
linked into the docs, and for whatever reason figured that out
by looking through code rather than our nicely detailed docs
that already explain it.

Part of blueprint image-precache-support

Change-Id: I0869979a1b8a0966f0e7b49e5a5984f76d7d67cd

[{'created': '2019-10-24 17:54:31.000000000', 'message': 'openvswitch: add vswitchd dependency on db

The openvswitch-vswitchd pod should not start until there is a Ready
openvswitch-vswitchd-db pod on the same node. This change adds the
appropriate dependency to cause it to wait.

Change-Id: I5c827971c99639d2f1c3a24a1761524b3a165421
'}]
commit_message:
openvswitch: add vswitchd dependency on db

The openvswitch-vswitchd pod should not start until there is a Ready
openvswitch-vswitchd-db pod on the same node. This change adds the
appropriate dependency to cause it to wait.

Change-Id: I5c827971c99639d2f1c3a24a1761524b3a165421

commit_message:
Bump coverage job to 75% and don't skip Octavia driver

Previously we had coverage job passing if coverage percentage
was higher than 65%. We just added Octavia provider driver
unittests, that bumps up coverage to 77%, so lets set 75% as
needed limit for coverage.

Change-Id: If4dd225ac94a99af333d5aaf017492da0a897cce

commit_message:
Router synch shouldn't return unrelated routers

[0] introduced the concept of connected routers: routers that are
connected to the same subnets. When a L3 agent is synching a router
with connected routers, the data of the entire set should be returned
to the agent by the Neutron server.

However, if an agent tries to synch a router with
no connected routers when the same agent has other routers that are
connected among them, the Neutron server returns the former and the
latter. For details of how this bug can manifest itself, please see [1].

This change prevents this situation: only the synched router is
returned.

[0] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/597567
[1] https://bugs.launchpad.net/neutron/+bug/1838449/comments/15

Change-Id: Ibbf35d0f4a0bf9281f0bc8c411e8527eed75361d
Closes-Bug: #1838449

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-11 09:41:09.000000000', 'message': 'Fix exception translation when creating volume

Method `nova.volume.cinder.API#create` accepts `size` as the 3rd args,
but in wrapper of `nova.volume.cinder.translate_volume_exception`, the 3rd
parameter is volume_id. If we hit cinder exception when creating volumes
like the response body down below:
```
{"itemNotFound": {"message": "Volume type with name xxx could not be found.",
"code": 404}}
```
we may get exception in nova compute log like this:
```
BuildAbortException: Build of instance xxx aborted: Volume 40 could not be
found.
```
actually, `40` is volume size, not voluem id.

This could be a little misleading.

Closes-Bug: #1846532

Change-Id: If5b0c2f28773e0b2fcb008d5251fb69d950ca569
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f9311fae19e4e204cdc601acbe7dafc49c73661)
(cherry picked from commit 821506a50c13c73a2877e20ed9efc37a80e5dff8)
(cherry picked from commit c0313bce0685b5c1b5f57502711ea9d88d67a332)
(cherry picked from commit 3903a906bf3e0c49971a7001e99c292ba8a41030)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix exception translation when creating volume

Method `nova.volume.cinder.API#create` accepts `size` as the 3rd args,
but in wrapper of `nova.volume.cinder.translate_volume_exception`, the 3rd
parameter is volume_id. If we hit cinder exception when creating volumes
like the response body down below:
```
{"itemNotFound": {"message": "Volume type with name xxx could not be found.",
"code": 404}}
```
we may get exception in nova compute log like this:
```
BuildAbortException: Build of instance xxx aborted: Volume 40 could not be
found.
```
actually, `40` is volume size, not voluem id.

This could be a little misleading.

Closes-Bug: #1846532

Change-Id: If5b0c2f28773e0b2fcb008d5251fb69d950ca569
Signed-off-by: Fan Zhang <zh.f@outlook.com>
(cherry picked from commit 0f9311fae19e4e204cdc601acbe7dafc49c73661)
(cherry picked from commit 821506a50c13c73a2877e20ed9efc37a80e5dff8)
(cherry picked from commit c0313bce0685b5c1b5f57502711ea9d88d67a332)
(cherry picked from commit 3903a906bf3e0c49971a7001e99c292ba8a41030)

commit_message:
Update ACLs for moved doc projects

This process was initiated in [1]. Make the Gerrit side of things
happen.

Update group for whereto, it should be part of openstack-doc-tools (on
Launchpad), not of documentation in Storyboard. Oslo does not use
storyboard currently and documentation is meant for Docs SIG.

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/c/657141/

Change-Id: Idefab0b104cf05f17fcf5c756f5e56f0ecc3e79e
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

How flexible is the EM release deadline? We're a cycle-trailing project, and depend on the releases of other projects. I proposed a patch to kolla to bump the versions of packages for the final queens releases (https://review.opendev.org/#/c/691299/), which should be landing soon. Ideally we'd cut a release including that change, then mark it as EM.

Sorry for not bringing this up sooner on the ML thread."}, {'account_id': 11904, 'date': '2019-10-25 16:20:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

commit_message:
Improve documentation on Ceilosca not needing Gnocchi

There was a recent question in IRC about how to configure Ceilosca.
These edits should make it clearer that Gnocchi is not needed
in a Ceilosca deployment, and how to disable it.

Change-Id: I25b894e1ad222e3b55c6787c0625c03b9ebdcbf1
(cherry picked from commit 187bda14471e03d4ce2f989f2bb33d05dfc47e12)

[{'created': '2019-07-09 11:46:01.000000000', 'message': 'CI should auto-generate server_certs_key_passphrase

Bug 1833942 showed that in a case that the generated value
server_certs_key_passphrase is invalid, Octavia will fail to operate.

In CI, we currently provide a pre-defined passphrase that might cover
for potential breakages in the future. This patch removes the
pre-defined passphrase so it will get generated on each run.

Note that, TripleO will now[1] either auto-generate a valid passphrase
or validate a pre-defined one.

Conflicts:
      ci/environments/scenario010-multinode-containers.yaml

Related-Bug: #1833942

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase-32chars

commit_message:
CI should auto-generate server_certs_key_passphrase

Bug 1833942 showed that in a case that the generated value
server_certs_key_passphrase is invalid, Octavia will fail to operate.

In CI, we currently provide a pre-defined passphrase that might cover
for potential breakages in the future. This patch removes the
pre-defined passphrase so it will get generated on each run.

Note that, TripleO will now[1] either auto-generate a valid passphrase
or validate a pre-defined one.

Related-Bug: #1833942

[1] https://review.opendev.org/#/q/topic:OctaviaServerCertsKeyPassphrase-32chars

commit_message:
Add shared 'oslo', 'oslo-independent' ACL files

While a lot of oslo projects have their own core group, not all of them
do. Introduce a shared 'oslo.config' file for the latter. We can
consider reducing the remaining projects later.

Change-Id: I9fbb2db6814026c68849c9823307de4c1bc6a954
Signed-off-by: Stephen Finucane <sfinucan@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Support grouping by timestamp in GET /v2/summary

Work items:

* Updated Elasticsearch and InfluxDB v2 storage backends in order to support
  grouping on time.

* Added a "dt_from_ts()" function to "cloudkitty.tzutils", along with unit
  tests. This function converts an epoch timestamp to a timezone-aware datetime
  object.

* Added unit tests for GET /v2/summary to validate grouping by time works as
  expected.

* Updated the API documentation.

Change-Id: Ia01fced0bdb3a9b389a89d56f02029b9456781c2
Story: 2006730
Task: 37153

revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-25 20:23:21.000000000', 'message': "Collect hardware facts if necessary for libvirt type

We're seeing failures where ansible_processor is missing. We should try
to do a hardware fact collection if ansible_processor is not defined
before executing the set-libvirt-type role tasks

Change-Id: I40ae758d687dd8f637c27c0e7acf76dbf60adb51
Closes-Bug: #1849895
"}]
commit_message:
Collect hardware facts if necessary for libvirt type

We're seeing failures where ansible_processor is missing. We should try
to do a hardware fact collection if ansible_processor is not defined
before executing the set-libvirt-type role tasks

Change-Id: I40ae758d687dd8f637c27c0e7acf76dbf60adb51
Closes-Bug: #1849895

This patch is bumping the timeout for the "chrony waitsync" command from
20 to 60. I understand its not easy to pick a hardcoded timeout interval
but 20 does not seem to be enough when deploying some slower machines
[0] in my experience.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/783888/

Change-Id: I07057eb089585f43346c44a03ae50aa2ac837fd7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}, {'created': '2019-10-15 14:51:33.000000000', 'message': 'Replace chronyc "waitsync" with "makestep"

Prior to this patch we had the "chrony waitsync" command with a
hardcoded timeout of "20". Sometimes that wasn't enough when deploying
on some slower machines in my experience [0].

This patch is changing the "waitsync" command to "makestep", that way
we tell chronyd to make the system clock correct immediately (instead
of gradually correcting the time). It should be fine for our usecase
because these are ran during the deployment.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/783888/

Change-Id: I07057eb089585f43346c44a03ae50aa2ac837fd7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Replace chronyc "waitsync" with "makestep"

Prior to this patch we had the "chrony waitsync" command with a
hardcoded timeout of "20". Sometimes that wasn't enough when deploying
on some slower machines in my experience [0].

This patch is changing the "waitsync" command to "makestep", that way
we tell chronyd to make the system clock correct immediately (instead
of gradually correcting the time). It should be fine for our usecase
because these are ran during the deployment.

[0] http://paste.openstack.org/show/783888/

Change-Id: I07057eb089585f43346c44a03ae50aa2ac837fd7
Signed-off-by: Lucas Alvares Gomes <lucasagomes@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Fixing base job

After this change https://review.opendev.org/690104 the agent
interface is not in the IRONIC_ENABLED_RESCUE_INTERFACES by
default, making all the jobs with
IRONIC_DEFAULT_RESCUE_INTERFACE: agent defined fail.
Since we don't run rescue test here, setting
IRONIC_DEFAULT_RESCUE_INTERFACE to "" should fix the issue.

Change-Id: I102beb36037bf994691085bf741dd0151b8d2631

commit_message:
Make placement a required interface as of train

Make placement a required interface for train and above as
placement is required in order to schedule instances.

I'm new to this code, so my comments must be taken with a grain of salt...

If I'm understanding the code properly, isn't this code reactively "undoing" something that shouldn't have happened in the first place?

That is -- AutoScheduler.auto_schedule_networks() already takes into account CONF.dhcp_agents_per_network, but yet here in bind() it needs to be accounted for again potentially deleting an existing binding. Is this because auto_schedule_networks() calls bind() outside of the transaction and thus it's not "atomic" and may not see other "bind()s" running in parallel?'}, {'account_id': 17491, 'date': '2016-04-14 01:50:52.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@boden, yes. You are seeing this perfectly right. The only reason for this patch to exist is that the "validation" procedure and "ADD transaction" procedure is not "atomic". When parallel bind() methods are running, we may end up with excess number of dhcp-agents.'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2016-04-18 19:14:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Isn't there some way to make them atomic in a granular enough fashion that's still performant?

It just seems like this might be a workaround and not the root cause fix?"}, {'account_id': 17491, 'date': '2016-04-19 00:04:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@boden, please correct me if I were wrong, to the best of my knowledge, if we want to solve this problem from the root, we need to use DLM (distributed locking manager, tooz). But this would be too far away and the discussion has just started in the Austin summit [1]. 
[1] https://etherpad.openstack.org/p/newton-neutron-summit-ideas'}, {'account_id': 5367, 'date': '2016-04-19 20:55:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Although I've seen some notes on DLM in neutron, I'm still too new to this code to know exactly where it applies and where it doesn't. So with that in mind, I'm not sure if there's a way to make it atomic without DLM : )

It would be nice if you could just ping a core to find out quick if this is the right approach (e.g. this patch). I think kevinbenton might be the core for this area of the code?

The code here looks fine to me, I just don't feel comfortable saying if this is the correct approach or not."}, {'account_id': 7787, 'date': '2016-06-07 03:28:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Code-Review-1

(2 comments)'}, {'account_id': 17491, 'date': '2016-06-09 08:35:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Sorry for letting this sit so long. I would prefer to take the same approach here that we did for the l3 agent router bindings table by adding a binding_index that just prevents too many DHCP agents from being scheduled in the first place.

The other issue with deleting an extra dhcp instance after it was already created is that a booting VM may already be using that instance for connectivity to metadata or for DNS.'}, {'account_id': 17491, 'date': '2017-03-16 07:23:08.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 15.'}, {'account_id': 7249, 'date': '2017-03-16 07:45:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 15: Code-Review-1

revisions:
[{'created': '2016-03-04 06:47:15.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple dhcp-agents hosting one network when auto-scheduling

This patch adds a clean-up function when dhcp-agents are auto-
scheduled to one network concurrently. Only one dhcp-agent is
allowed to be automatically hosting the network.

Change-Id: I1bc3f8b69c337f7c1cf7375509a0da61def9baf1
Closes-Bug: #1535554
'}, {'created': '2016-03-04 06:49:22.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple dhcp-agents hosting one network when auto-scheduling

This patch adds clean-ups when multiple dhcp-agents are auto-
scheduled to one network concurrently. Only one dhcp-agent is
kept to be automatically hosting the network.

Change-Id: I1bc3f8b69c337f7c1cf7375509a0da61def9baf1
Closes-Bug: #1535554
'}, {'created': '2016-03-11 06:54:04.000000000', 'message': 'Avoid multiple dhcp-agents being auto-scheduled to one network

This patch adds clean-ups when the number of dhcp-agents which
are auto-scheduled to one network is more than the configured
number. Only the configured number of alive dhcp-agent is kept
to be automatically hosting the network.

The patch proposes adding a new binding_index to the
NetworkDhcpAgentBinding table, with an additional Unique
Constraint that enforces a single <network_id, binding_index>
per network.

1. When a network is triggered to be auto-scheduled to DHCP
agents, the number of DHCP agents is constrained by
dhcp_agents_per_network in neutron.conf. This prevents
too many DHCP agents from being scheduled in the first place.

2. If users mannually schedule a network to specific DHCP
agents, the binding_index increments to show the number of
DHCP agents hosting this network.

Change-Id: I1bc3f8b69c337f7c1cf7375509a0da61def9baf1
Closes-Bug: #1535554

commit_message:
Add binding_index to NetworkDhcpAgentBinding

The patch proposes adding a new binding_index to the
NetworkDhcpAgentBinding table, with an additional Unique
Constraint that enforces a single <network_id, binding_index>
per network.

1. When a network is triggered to be auto-scheduled to DHCP
agents, the number of DHCP agents is constrained by
dhcp_agents_per_network in neutron.conf. This prevents
too many DHCP agents from being scheduled in the first place.

2. If users manually schedule a network to specific DHCP
agents, the binding_index increments to show the number of
DHCP agents hosting this network.

Co-Authored-By: Oleg Bondarev <obondarev@mirantis.com>
Change-Id: I1bc3f8b69c337f7c1cf7375509a0da61def9baf1
Closes-Bug: #1535554

commit_message:
Bugfix: _needs_programming lack one situation process

The situation:
First, we create one vm with bitstream successfully and then we delete it.

Then we updated the device_profile without bitstream, re-created the vm
and will report an error. Please see the Story link for specific errors.

The reason for the error is that there is a lack of judge, resulting in
method _needs_programming return True which should return False.

Story: 2006767

Change-Id: I7ac8f164b748e9f54d8fd82737b7d8d37cbd8030

messages: [{'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-03-29 13:46:17.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-03-29 14:01:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review-1'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-04-01 12:13:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Workflow-1'}, {'account_id': 29425, 'date': '2019-10-28 16:08:26.000000000', 'content': 'Abandoned\n\nexpired'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-03-29 13:46:17.000000000', 'message': ' [k8s] Add missing container_prefix parameter

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_tag to allow user to specify container
image
* Updated the release features and added deprecation notice for
heapster
* Updated the documentation for the Images that must be mirrored

Change-Id: I26448615900058dea3ab05db0d1ddbc735257eb9
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>'}]
commit_message:
[k8s] Add missing container_prefix parameter

Magnum allows to use CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to specify a local
repository from which we can pull container images. This repository
defaults to the upstream one that is specified in the metrics helm
chart.

* This patch allows for the usage of CONTAINER_INFRA_PREFIX to
correctly configure the pull of the metric-server container image
from the specified repo.
* Add label metrics_server_tag to allow user to specify container
image
* Updated the release features and added deprecation notice for
heapster
* Updated the documentation for the Images that must be mirrored

Change-Id: I26448615900058dea3ab05db0d1ddbc735257eb9
Signed-off-by: Diogo Guerra <dy090.guerra@gmail.com>

Back to PS1 since https://review.opendev.org/#/c/688997/ is merged now, I think we get pep8 with the ussuri template.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:38:56.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Code-Review-1

Shouldn't we have a release note for this?"}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:44:10.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Workflow-1

> Shouldn't we have a release note for this?

For os-resource-classes? Shrug, can do."}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:46:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:54:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> For os-resource-classes? Shrug, can do.

It's a library..."}, {'account_id': 6873, 'date': '2019-10-25 14:54:51.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2

Looks OK to me now.'}, {'account_id': 25625, 'date': '2019-10-28 01:19:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1

This looks good to me as it is. Thanks!

The release note looks as if it is missing train release,
but this is because we switched the model from cycle-with-intermediary to independent from 0.12.0.
 Is it too late to note that in the release note?'}, {'account_id': 14070, 'date': '2019-10-28 15:58:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> The release note looks as if it is missing train release,
> but this is because we switched the model from cycle-with-intermediary > to independent from 0.12.0.

This is... an interesting question.

>  Is it too late to note that in the release note?

Since we haven't cut a release yet, I think it's not too late to modify the release note.

But what would it say? The overall upper-constraints for the train release indicate that you're not supposed to use anything higher than 0.5.0. And as soon as we do cut a new os-resource-classes, at least the placement project will immediately set the minimum to that.

But those restrictions are kind of outside of the view of os-resource-classes itself.

So given the way the release notes will show up -- with the py3 limitation noted against whatever the next release is -- I think it's probably correct not to even mention train/ussuri.

But I'm not sure. What do others think?"}, {'account_id': 11564, 'date': '2019-10-28 16:07:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

> But I'm not sure. What do others think?

Eric and I talked about this and related issues at http://eavesdrop.openstack.org/irclogs/%23openstack-placement/latest.log.html#t2019-10-28T15:58:35

summary is: would be nice of os-* mentioned somewhere that they are now on independent release schedule, but not end of world to not do it if if requires too much effort"}]

subject: Add IPv6 support to dnsmasq example
messages: [{'account_id': 21909, 'date': '2019-10-22 18:03:10.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 1.'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-10-28 09:13:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2'}, {'account_id': 23851, 'date': '2019-10-28 10:19:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Code-Review+2 Workflow+1'}, {'account_id': 10239, 'date': '2019-10-28 15:45:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Cherry Picked\n\nThis patchset was cherry picked to branch stable/train as commit 7beeeaaebc3589149df3805d3f72fca188a25eb8'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2019-10-22 18:03:10.000000000', 'message': 'Add IPv6 support to dnsmasq example

This adds IPv6 support to the documented dnsmasq example.
For DHCPv6 PXE boot, the Client Architecture option uses code 61,
(see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5970#section-3.3). For both
DHCP and DHCPv6, support for UEFI client arch type 11 (EFI aarch64)
is documented.

Change-Id: I4018d99b9723527ed0cbb2c6825b0062d82c85b1
'}]
commit_message:
Add IPv6 support to dnsmasq example

This adds IPv6 support to the documented dnsmasq example.
For DHCPv6 PXE boot, the Client Architecture option uses code 61,
(see https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5970#section-3.3). For both
DHCP and DHCPv6, support for UEFI client arch type 11 (EFI aarch64)
is documented.

Change-Id: I4018d99b9723527ed0cbb2c6825b0062d82c85b1
